Reviews.Title: “Old world charm in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: Safarib0und
Reviews.Content: This hotel still maintains all the old world charm that many older properties have since lost with their renovations. The rooms are unique and completely awash in period details. The service from arrival to departure was exceptional yet unobtrusive. The dinner on the terrace, while expensive, was delicious and the breakfast buffet lived up to its excellent reputation. The experience is exactly what I expected from a hotel of this caliber and history. Would absolutely stay here again the next time I'm in Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Pricey hotel with lovely rooms.”
Reviews.Author: T V
Reviews.Content: The cost of the hotel, I spent $450 a night without breakfast was not really worth it. The room was spacious and charming as you can see the details of its old world charm. The hotel key was large and clanky. The cost of water in the lobby bar was $18 for a bottle. For an orient express hotel, this was my favorite. It is very conveniently located. Near museums and transportation. Lots of dining in this area.

Reviews.Title: “Charming”
Reviews.Author: LondonJc
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed for just a night recently. We would love to return when time allows. This is an exceptionally elegant hotel. It is grand yet also homely. Dinner in the garden was magnificent and one of the most enjoyable meals in terms of food and setting that I can recall. This a splendid hotel with excellent service.

Reviews.Title: “Belle Époque Elegance”
Reviews.Author: Alex M
Reviews.Content: A beautiful, centrally located hotel that has been preserved very well. We stayed there shortly after attending an exhibit on the Titanic, and the feeling of traveling back to the early 20th century was overwhelming. For example, where can one find today wall-mounted solid brass ashtrays in the bathrooms? Of course it is non-smocking hotel, a necessity in the less-civilized 21st century, but still, the old brass fixings in the bathrooms and the solid hardwoods everywhere bestowed a charm of old. Good size, comfortable rooms with enormous closet space, overlooking the Prado. We unfortunately had no time for the brunch, presumably among the best in Madrid. Very Expensive, of course, but it is worth it, if you can afford it.

Reviews.Title: “Special Heaven”
Reviews.Author: fromtex
Reviews.Content: My husband and I selected this hotel because of its old world, elegant charm. It does not disappoint. The suite had a round livingroom overlooking the Prada. My parents (in their 80's) had the bedroom to the left of the living room and my husband and I had the bedroom to the right. The windows open and below to the right was the relaxing outdoor garden with service, fountains and a pianist. We enjoyed the garden once for drinks and snacks and again at tea time. Breakfast buffet was included and we felt like we were a part of the Ritz family. Our rooms were on the 4th floor and we slept well. There is in room coffee service with lots of choices which my husband and Dad enjoyed surprising Mom and me with. Upon returning from our outings treats were waiting. The room came with fresh flowers and my husband treated us by ordering more which were well done by the hotel. White lilies and white roses. Beautiful. A wonderful start to our Spanish Vacation. We loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Olde world gracious hotel”
Reviews.Author: BBear52
Reviews.Content: In the perfect location close to all we wanted to do and see. Our Iberian fight arrived at 5.45 from Buenos Aires still dark at 7ish when we arrived at the Ritz, our welcome was warm and helpful. Our room was booked for 2pm but flight scheduling....We were given a room almost straight away to shower and sleep until our room was ready, this all occurred without any fanfare other than as excellent hosts looking to help us! We booked a driving tour of Madrid through the charming concierge at 3pm. Showered and 4 hours sleep later we went to the Thyseen(sp) gallery across the boulevard (5mins) past Neptunes fountain. A black Mercedes with guide driver showed us Madrid at 3pm, this is the Ritz own service and from the excellent knowledge of everything Madrid (customs, religion, politics) our Romainian guide was warm and generous. The 3hours went quickly and we were very grateful for the comfort in the 39c heat. Our room is lovely, quirky even, a key for the door. We appreciate the charm of this Ritz, it is definitely not for minimalists. The service is at a level of unconscious excellence, they are natural so deep embedded is hospitality. The Brazilian reception manager, the concierge, our guide/driver wonderful. I have worked in executive management in a major international hotel group and I lecture in leadership- these host are at the best level I have encountered. Bravo (more please!) The Prado 'Ritz guided' tomorrow...........

Reviews.Title: “Luxury and Service at it's BEST”
Reviews.Author: TonyN76
Reviews.Content: We spent 6 wonderful nights at the Hotel Ritz in Madrid. Every part of our stay was exceptional from check in to departure. We had a suite which was exquisite. Every detail was seen to. The location is perfect, just across the street from the Prado and the Thyssen. It is a short walk to the metro and the hop on, hop off tour bus stops just outside the door. The breakfast buffet was excellent. The service was top notch. When we go back to Madrid we will certainly stay at the Hotel Ritz.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: Travelleralways2
Reviews.Content: classic service, delightful garden and terrace, excellent manhattan in the lobby bar, good bedroom with large bathroom - exactly what you would expect from leading hotels brand - this was my second stay and I will return. also super location for museums and centre of city

Reviews.Title: “Bella!”
Reviews.Author: FabCL
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a beautiful hotel and intro to Spain. The actual key to your room and a new treat everyday in your room is a nice touch. The tub is a mile long and the one door in and out can be a pain, but very common in Europe. It was beautiful and is close to everything. It is right next door to everything and the concierge set up all of our wishes to a tee! Wonderful!

Reviews.Title: “Great property and great location”
Reviews.Author: Colleyville_traveler
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed the Hotel Ritz. The location is great with the Prado right across the street, the Nautical Museum and Thyssen within easy walking distance. The service was excellent, the hotel people very helpful and accomodating. Fun selection of DVDs that you can borrow. Free Internet throughout the hotel (which other hotels we stayed at did not offer). The garden restaurant was fun to have a snack or drink (prices are high however, as with most 5 star hotels). We had breakfast included, which was a nice buffet with good choices. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great service in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Nnrntravels
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Ritz was a great place to stay! Walking distance to many neighborhoods. Great food and service. Our room was lovely, very clean and great size.

Reviews.Title: “O.K.”
Reviews.Author: calaway354
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Hotel Ritz for 3 nights in June. The hotel is beautiful. The service was very good and the rooms were pretty. The beds were fine....not great, but fine. We had two rooms for our family. Our two daughters had a lovely, large room with a king bed but my husband and I had a very small room. They upgraded us without charge. Our rooms overlooked the Prado and we spent several days visiting the museum. I am hesitant to say this, but we suspected that there may have been bed bugs in our rooms. Both my husband (in our room) and my daughter (in another room) came away from our stay with a series of bites along their legs. My daughters were somewhat in a line (consistent with bed bugs) and they were small. My husbands were more spread out on his lower legs. I had a few bites on my arms and my other daughter had just a couple on her legs. It did not occur to us until later that bedbugs could be the source, so we didn't check the mattresses. So....I am just putting this out there. It might be something to take a look for.

Reviews.Title: “Nicest hotel I have ever been to...and I travel a lot!”
Reviews.Author: max2lucy
Reviews.Content: My first time in Madrid, and on a business trip. This hotel is the most beautiful and gracious place I have ever been to, and I have over the years stayed at a number of nice places around the world..this ranks at the top. The decor is very "old world" but you can tell it has been recently updated but they have kept to the details of the original fittings, all the way down to the light switches and door knobs and the little things that make it a class of its own. The staff was all very professional and helpful. I had breakfast in the dining room and it was the best of my 2 week trip to Europe...a lot of variety, not the usual cold cuts and pastries. Rooms and common areas were spotless and the location, while central to the museums and parks, was very quiet (the main entry is on a bit of a separate road from the main traffic so its offset a bit, which is nice. I was only here one night but would love to come back again soon.

Reviews.Title: “Charmed”
Reviews.Author: Goteed1
Reviews.Content: Stayed here as a treat for my lastnight in Spain through a deal with Amex. From the moment I approached the hotel until the moment I left I was totally overwhelmed by the fantastic service. I was ushered into into registration my luggage was taken and I was given a thorough overview of the hotel and my room. I was upgraded to a nice suite overlooking the Prado. Since the room was not ready they walked me over to the lounge and let me have a drink on the house while they got the room cleaned. When it was done, they escorted me up and delivered my luggage. The room was phenomenal. Although it was an old classic style, it was still kept up and the bathroom was completely updated. I ran out for about an hour and found that they had given me a turndown service with a nice chocolate and slippers by the bed. About an hour later the hotel sent up a bottle of champagne as a gift. I thought maybe it was a mistake? Nope. 30minutes later they sent up a cake and water as a gift as well! Breakfast was included in my rate and was fabulous. I also received a ride to the airport as part of the deal in the hotel mercedes. Checking out was a little chaotic, only 1 person available and a few people waiting to check in or out. By now I was a spoiled little customer (It's your own fault guys!) SO I asked the concierge to check me out and he very cheerfully obliged. This hotel is a wonderful treat if you are visiting Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Francesca R
Reviews.Content: I was here a month ago in april I had an amazing time and so did my parents, we had afternoon tea, went to La Goya restaurant spent a lot more time in the hotel than intented but I didnt mind. The rooms were great and so was the service! I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Beutiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kloreece
Reviews.Content: Undeniably Beutiful. I checked in and was entitled to a room upgrade through the Leaders Club. I was given what appeared to be a classic room as it was identical to the classic room pictured on the hotel's website. I was assured the room was a deluxe room. Nevertheless, the rooms manager upgraded us. I rather not have the stress but was glad the situation was resolved. The service can be haughty enough to be unfriendly but the hotel is physically spectacular.

Reviews.Title: “Old world charm”
Reviews.Author: miceguru
Reviews.Content: When you step into this hotel you are in a world people enjoyed 100 years ago, and I wish there were more of those. The location is the best, the atmosphere is authentic, the service is superior, what else can you ask for?

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic break!”
Reviews.Author: pianophil
Reviews.Content: My wife and I booked a 3-night break with two friends. Everything is as you would expect of a Ritz hotel - superb decor and ambience, wonderful service and our dinner, although expensive, was excellent. There is always live piano music in the lounge (I counted five different pianists while we there) and they looked after us with warmth and total efficiency. We look forward to returning!

Reviews.Title: “great hotel in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: truth40
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a 1 bedroom suite and it was really nice! although you could hear the plumbing system since it is quite an old hotel. although service was excellent! Breakfast was great!! most important is that they had slippers which actually fit you instead of just having a flipflop that makes you trip all the time.Room service was great!!!

Reviews.Title: “Anniversary Treat”
Reviews.Author: ChrisCarmen
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay at this elegant hotel. Everything was top notch - nice breakfast buffet, excellent service, helpful concierge and front desk staff. We had a room with a king size bed and a nice view. Try to get a package which includes your breakfast which adds value.

Reviews.Title: “Putting on the Ritz!”
Reviews.Author: Ed S
Reviews.Content: Super service, rooms, staff, on and on. The Madrid Ritz sets the standards of elegance. Not for those on a buget! Sterling silverware, fine china, and crystal even when ordering room service.

Reviews.Title: “Small upgrades needed to become the best in hotel in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: Gudleiv
Reviews.Content: The location of this great hotel is the best in town, right next to the park and in the middle of it all. The building is beautiful, the service is great and the building itself is as unique as the Ritz in Paris or London. But, the beds must be upgraded! Also, there needs to be some updates here and there to make it the best in Madrid. Now its among the top 5!

Reviews.Title: “Fit for a Queen.”
Reviews.Author: LASGarcia
Reviews.Content: We had excellent service while staying here, and our rooms were well appointed and very comfortable. We especially loved spending time sitting in the garden for tea time and ice cream. Dinner on the balcony under the awning was also excellent.

Reviews.Title: “A place to visit for a drink or meal, even if not staying there”
Reviews.Author: Gato188
Reviews.Content: The Ritz Madrid is a place to visit even if – like us - you have chosen not to stay there. We can't comment on the standard of rooms accommodation, and our ratings here should be read as relating only to the ambience of the place, and its restaurant/bar offerings. With the Westin Palace (where we stayed) on the other side of Paseo del Prado and the Neptune fountain, the Ritz is one of the two top five-star hotels in the heart of old Madrid. As to be expected from the name, it is a classic hotel in the belle époque tradition. We visited in late winter, in January, and in February, 2012. At this time one of the best features of the Ritz for food and beverage, its famed garden terrace, was closed. The Lobby Bar was the liveliest and most attractive place to be in the Ritz when we visited. We recommend it for a coffee or snack. Both the décor and the food at the Ritz's Goya Restaurant impressed us less than the Rotonda at the Westin Palace across the road. Staff we met during two visits were pleasant, helpful and professional. The Ritz is a classic hotel, in a convenient location near the Prado Museum and many other sights of old Madrid, although seeming a little dowdier than the famed Ritz in Paris. We would consider going back there for a meal, and would consider it when choosing accommodation for future visits to Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “teatime not really achieved- avoid pastries and maybe tea”
Reviews.Author: bonstanislas
Reviews.Content: this place could be one of the nicest in madrid but the white illumination as well as the very old fashion service make it outdated and far from the standard you coukld expect. Pay attention to the waiters clothes and shoes and you will understand you are not in Ritz Paris, Pierre New York etc.... just ok for locals

Reviews.Title: “old world madrid”
Reviews.Author: CathalTM
Reviews.Content: If your looking to spend a few days walking the highlights of Madrid, this is a great base. Its understated old world charm is exemplified by the personal greeting (by name) you get at the door each time you come or go, and the attentive service in the foyer lounge, bar and restaurant. The rooms are showing signs of wear and tear but as you would expect they are classy with subtle charm and nice accents. Our room had not been redesigned thankfully, so it had a wonderful writing bureau, extremely large walk-in closets and an odd shaped small bath room. It had a noisy heater/ac unit, but as it was January an open window worked even better to cool the room. The breakfast which you should get included was excellent (great selection and service) and a great way to start the day and get you in the spirit of Madrid from a window table in the dining room.

Reviews.Title: “Very grand”
Reviews.Author: Rhone_Man
Reviews.Content: The Ritz is a very sumptuous old style hotel. It was built about 100 years ago and it feels about that old, both in the good and the negative sense. Although very well appointed, you can feel the age in some of the fixed furnishings like closets etc. But equally it does have flat screen TVs and multi-lingual satellite channels. By Madrid standards it is not cheap, but it is certainly pleasant and very central. The wireless is free throughout the hotel, although a smidge patchy. The food and the bar are good, although expensive, and given the extensive array of excellent restaurants nearby it may make more sense just to eat out. Most of the people I saw there (including myself) were on business. It might suit an older couple as well, but would not be well suited for families. Those looking for a more modern hotel would be disappointed. Those who enjoy old world charm in a lovely European capital would feel they got what they paid for.

Reviews.Title: “Great tea time!”
Reviews.Author: PepoT78
Reviews.Content: I’ve never stayed here, but I want to share my great experience having tea time. I had a wonderful afternoon surrounded by piano music in a relaxing atmosphere. The tea, just excellent: I had some scones with cream and marmalade, some sandwiches with cheese, salmon, etc, and biscuits. The service was very good, and the price, affordable! It’s a good recommendation if you want to relax a bit in the middle of a big city!

Reviews.Title: “Needs lighting”
Reviews.Author: Dale K
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel , excellent service, everyone very nice and professional . There were only A few negatives.... The bathroom lighting was not good and the bedroom lighting was not good. The room was very dark. The shower head could not be adjusted And the shower was very small. We did have a lovely suite which was very spacious and comfortable. Good closets and bed.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel to stay in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: annny467
Reviews.Content: Its location makes it very convenient as a tourist. The service is excellent. no matter how much you pay for the room you are treated equally. They surprised me every day with little treats!! they were delicious! my family and I felt spoiled in this hotel. The rooms were gorgeous and very specious. Stay here if you have the chance to visit Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Old world charm and service.”
Reviews.Author: TKTKFTP
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in this beautiful hotel on a recent trip to Madrid. I picked this hotel from Trip advisor and was glad I did. The hotel was central to most sights, if you wanted to catch the Hop on Hop off bus or visit the Prado Museum they were 2 minutes walk away. We had a spacious suite with a canopy bed and it was very old world and comfortable. The bathroom was spacious and had a large bathtub with a shower in it. The restaurants and lounges in the hotel were very luxurious. It was a bit like staying in a luxury home. The breakfast was substantial and the service very efficient. I would highly recommend this hotel as a place to stay in Madrid. A lovely boutique type hotel without the large hotel feel!

Reviews.Title: “tiny rooms bad service”
Reviews.Author: Yeswhere
Reviews.Content: They must be joking to call this a Ritz Hotel unless they mean ritz crackers. I checked into the hotel for two night on a stopover between Miami and Moscow due to some kind of weather problem in Central Europe. I didn't have a reservation, so when I called they "offered" me a full fare. Above $ 500. I was on a corporate account so I accepted. The rooms are tiny. the food is UNBELIEVABLE expensive. The decor is form the 60s. But the worst was still to come. The service is absolutely unacceptable. Not a smile. Not a greeting. Not a welcome. Not a thank you. Must of the waiters don`t speak english.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: New York, New York, United States
Reviews.Title: “Exceptional!”
Reviews.Author: Joshua P
Reviews.Content: The best hotel I have ever stayed in. All the comfort you would expect, but what really sets it apart is its exceptional service. Unbelievable.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury and Perfection Still Exist at the Hotel Ritz in Madrid, Spain”
Reviews.Author: diana z
Reviews.Content: Staying at the 5 star Ritz Hotel is an overwhelming introduction to a tradition of elegance that most of us can only read about in famous novels or experience in movies from the 1930's and 1940's. you walk in through the revolving door and are literally transported to a time gone by-----you check in and one of the very competent staff escorts you to your room, where if your luggage isn't waiting for you, arrives in under a minute! once you have checked in , there is a lovely and thoughtful welcome pastry and fruit platter sent to your room---and if you pick up the phone to ask for anything, you are referred to by name---and they REMEMBER your name during your entire stay. the rooms are spotless and comfortable, with double windows to keep out any sounds that would bother you and interfere with your rest---bathrooms are spacious and housekeeping does an amazing job every day in keeping your room fresh---and the linens, the turn down service at night and that delicious piece of chocolate on your pillow (the choices of pillows is not to be believed ) send you off to sweet dreams---it is all just too perfect. the breakfast , whether on the terrace or in the grand dining room is plentiful and delicious---and if you have special dietary needs or restrictions, those requests can be met quite easily--all with a staff that smiles and welcomes you every time you are in a common area.... like the unbelievable lobby and sitting room---old fashioned couches in superb condition, plumped up all day long, a pianist playing softly in the background, chandeliers that twinkle and give off the most beautiful hue, and not one bit of dust-----this hotel is 100 years old, how do they do it???? during the day, the director and others from his staff walk through the common areas of the hotel and greet the guests and ask if everything is fine, and if you need anything....be careful if you say yes, for they will get it for you! the location is perfect----the Prado is 100 steps (or less) from the Ritz, Retiro Park is up the street, the Thyssen is down the street, the botanical garden is next to the Prado, the hop on/off tour buses are around the corner-----could this hotel have a more perfect location?? in the world we now live in security is a very important component to one's safety, and at the Ritz you are in a very secure and peaceful environment.---security and safety are a number 1 priority at this 5 star hotel. there is a sweet smell to Madrid and especially at the Ritz ---i think it may have something to do with the botanical gardens so near---but to try and explain this to someone who has not experienced it first hand is very difficult---if they could "bottle" this scent i would buy a case of it. . finally, and i guess this is the intangible part of the Ritz, but from the moment you walk in you "decompress" from your flight and the worries of your life, to a soothing, relaxing , environment where the staff at the Ritz wants nothing more than to make you happy and welcome----and this they do from the moment you arrive until you have to leave------Bravo Hotel Ritz.---.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive Add on costs - Beware”
Reviews.Author: Beverley H
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Ritz Madrid for a friends wedding. The wedding was excellent, food delicious and overall the hotel looked after the wedding party as you would expect from a 5 star hotel. However 2 incidents shocked me. 1. I pre booked a hairdresser to do a wash and Blow dry, As the hairdressers at the Hotel was closed in August they offered to bring in a local hairdresser just 10 mins away to my room. At no point did they tell me the cost and I did not ask as I assumed it would be on the high side but an acceptable price. I was charged for 22 minutes 150 Euros paid in Cash. To give you a comparison I had the same service at the Four Seasons in Provence in June of this year and was charged 75 Euros. Half the price. I am wondering how much commisiion was paid for this appointment!! 2. I urgently needed my 2 dresses for the evening pressed, they had a couple of creases from the flight. This took about 30 minutes, I understand it is termed under 2 hours service and there is a charge but could not beleive it the next day when I was charged 175 Euros. This was just 50 Euros under the cost of the room!!! I have since checked with two General Managers of 5 star Hotels in London ( Friends of mine) and they have agreed that the max they would charge is about 70 Euros. Bathrooms good, rooms very grand, not a great size but overall a pleasant place to stay but not when the extras are overpriced!!

Reviews.Title: “elegant, though a bit old...”
Reviews.Author: jledesma
Reviews.Content: For a 100-year-old hotel, this was certainly a very elegant one. The decor is outstanding, the hotel very clean. Service was excellent... However, the age shows in the doors of the rooms and room closets - it was difficult to open the doors with old style keys. The toilet was tiny... Spain being what it is, what we hoped would be a pleasant/relaxing experience by having coffee on the lawn was spoiled by the strong smell of smoke - of course that's becasue almost everybody in Spain smokes...

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great location, elegant”
Reviews.Author: ZoranG
Reviews.Content: Our experience with this hotel is great. It is located just across Prado Museum and in front of Retiro park. It has beautiful terrace with nice trees where breakfast is served. Staff was very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: sunlover033
Reviews.Content: Old world style in a wonderful location. The hotel provided champagne and fruit in our upgraded suite. We couldnt ask for more. The breakfast buffet on the outdoor garden terrace overlooking the Prado, while listening to soothing piano, made it perfect. A great classic hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Superb”
Reviews.Author: MikeD1948
Reviews.Content: We stayed some time ago on a business trip to Madrid, on a surprisingly good value deal, otherwise probably would not consider it. The hotel is exactly what you would expect from the name "Ritz" - except maybe if you are a celebrity type and used to that standard. In short - old world sumptuous elegance, superb service, superb room. If you can stand the price, or obtain a good deal and want to be in the centre of Madrid, this is the place. To recommend it further, almost next door is the Prado - another superb experience not to be missed.

Reviews.Title: “Great name, great location, but not much else!”
Reviews.Author: RM72
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel at Madrid for 3-4 nights. The hotel has an old world charm, having served for more than 100 years. Its guest list reads as World's Who's Who list, with several of the top personalities of the world having stayed here. The location of the hotel is also great. Having said that, I did not really find the rooms to be comfortable. Exuding its supposedly old world allure, the furniture has peculiar corners in which you keep bumping. There is no tea/coffee kettle in the room. And the most disappointing feature was its breakfast. The spread was poor as compared to the cost of the room (more than Euro 300 per night). In fact, I felt that for a much more favourable price, excellent service, excellent location and excellent breakfast, one would rather stay in INTERCONTINENTAL at Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Great location . Excellent service !!”
Reviews.Author: Patrickva
Reviews.Content: The hotel well deserve the reputation ... Excellent service , the employees are very friendly and you feel comfortable , plenty of details , 100 years of history and experience in receiving clients .... The hotel will need to refurbish , particularly in the rooms ... The carpet is particularly desgasted .. The connectivity in general is not up to the hotel reputation . Very small Tv screen ... Old fashion air-conditioning , Old service control panel in the room .. The Internet was very good ! The breakfast buffet is great , excellent quality food and perfect service ... The check out was quick and efficient ... Will recommend the hotel to my friends !

Reviews.Title: “Wedding and stay at the Ritz--beyond fabulous”
Reviews.Author: medano111
Reviews.Content: We organised our wedding at the Ritz in mid-July 2011--hired the entire garden for the 12 am ceremony, and then gave a wedding breakfast and ball until late at night. We also stayed a few days at the hotel before and after the wedding, so I think I have a pretty good idea about this magnificent hotel. It is actually difficult to describe the extremely high standard of this hotel--having been to the very best hotels in the world, I would still say that the Ritz in Madrid is a notch above the rest. I agree with other reports that this hotel exemplifies old World elegance--but it is so much more than that. Throughout the preparation of our wedding and on other occasions where I have visited the hotel (e.g. for lunch with my parents as a young boy) I have always had the impression that this was a second home to me in every aspect, from the warm personal treatment from absolutely every member of the staff to the extreme discretion and unobtrusiveness that you experience every second inside the hotel. This is my best hotel experience ever.

Reviews.Title: “Old world elegance”
Reviews.Author: Cristina O
Reviews.Content: For my husband's first trip to Europe and my first trip back since living there 10 years ago, I wanted to show him the beauty of Madrid. I was afraid that it might not live up to the 5 star standard since many European hotels can be older and run down. We definitely experienced elegance by staying at the Hotel Ritz. The hotel is absolutely gorgeous but modernized with free WiFi in each room. Our breakfast was included through Amex Platinum Fine Hotel program and it was a great way to start each day. The hotel is located adjacent to the Prado and easy walking distance to Plaza Santana, Puerta del Sol and the Retiro. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Service - Great Location”
Reviews.Author: danixnyc
Reviews.Content: Service is impecable, the concierge is resourceful and creative. Perfect location next to the Prado, and not far from all other cultural attractions, parks, and shopping. Our room was very large and very clean with lovely views over the Plaza. The Linen bedsheets wore pressed to perfection and a dream. The only reason I'm giving this 4 starts is that it all the room decor looked a bit tired. We only had breakfast at the hotel and that was excellent. I would definitely return and recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Simply AMAZING!!”
Reviews.Author: SLaila
Reviews.Content: This hotel took my breath away. It was excellent on every level. A luxury hotel with personable and helpful staff, excellent location and magnificent rooms. I could feel this history seeping through the walls without it being stuffy or dated. This is what a hotel should be. Something like Grand Hotel in the synonymous 1930s movie but BETTER!!

Reviews.Title: “We loved it”
Reviews.Author: ClaudiaRR
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a Junior Suite for our honeymoon. Had a nice bottle of wine and fruits on our arrival - which was much appreciated. This hotel has an excellent location near the museums and very helpful and attentive service. The concierge was able to recommend excellent restaurants and things to do, and our experience of Madrid was all the better for it. While I usually prefer the more modern hotels, the Ritz Madrid has a nice charm to it. Will definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Unforgetable experience”
Reviews.Author: pinturita545
Reviews.Content: The Ritz Hotel in Madrid is absolutelly the best place to stay in the City. Their staff is courteous and friendly, the offer an impecable service. I definetly recommend this fine hotel for your stay in Madrid

Reviews.Title: “Nice but not my first choice in Madrid for the price”
Reviews.Author: felicityineurope
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location and in a lovely building with attentive staff. You can expect a piano player in the bar, turn-down service and porters. It does, however, have a bit of a feel of an Orient Express marketing effort in a kind of tacky way. Personally I think it’s overpriced for what it is but then again I generally prefer a more understated, modern hotel. Nothing wrong with the hotel at all, it just wouldn’t be my preference.

Reviews.Title: “Putting me off at the Ritz!”
Reviews.Author: 7continentsby25
Reviews.Content: It needs a facelift! Musty and old feeling. It's the Ritz! I expected more! Great location. I enjoyed the tart that was waiting for me on arrival but I enjoyed the burger king I had that night after my tour of the prado just as much. Always stay in 5 stars and this wasn't up to snuff! What happened? Maybe it was great back in 82 and by 82 I mean 1882. Madrid is passé. Go to Barcelona. I wanted to love it but you can't force love.

Reviews.Title: “Overrated”
Reviews.Author: ZAP9
Reviews.Content: The hotel is nice, it is famous for its carpets (which I found a bit ware off). The standard rooms are quite small, although the bathroom is relatively large compared with the rest of the room. All in all, the rooms are fine. What I really found outrageous were the prices of the mini bar and restaurant. They were really exagerated and unjustified. the location is great, very near the Prado, and Tyssen museums and shopping areas. But there are other luxury hotels in the same area with more reasonable prices.

Reviews.Title: “Everything we wanted”
Reviews.Author: PatrickBrompton
Reviews.Content: We had a long weekend in Madrid including 4 nights bed and breakfast at the Ritz. The location was perfect for our museum visits in that the Prado, Thyssen and Reina Sofia were all just a short walk away. The hotel is a slightly faded beauty but still attractive, comfortable and important. Breakfast under the Rotunda was a particular pleasure in watching the world and his wife at the weekend and Spanish business meetings on Monday and Tuesday. The staff were charming and helpful. Our package was very good value. If I have any complaint it would be that while fresh, hot coffee was readily available at breakfast it took several attempts to get strong English breakfast tea (but we were in Spain so let us keep that complaint in its proper, tiny place).

Reviews.Title: “Service does not live up to the price”
Reviews.Author: dkgrossman
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Madrid Ritz for 5 nights in April of 2011. It is a beautiful old hotel, currently celebrating its 100 year anniversary. We had requested an upgrade if available through our travel agent to a suite, and we got one, so we were initially very pleased. These were about the only things we liked. When we checked in, we stopped in the lobby for a drink. Now, I don't mind paying up to stay in a great hotel, but I don't want to be gouged and insulted. The price for a vodka and tonic was 22 Euros, or nearly $30 for one drink. Are you kidding me? We didn't spend one penny on food or drink at the hotel after that, just on principle. We did, however, have breakfast each morning as part of our package. Unfortunately, the food, coffee and service in this beautiful dining room were all extremely poor. Also, the entire lobby reeks of some sort of cheap scent, sort of like that carpet cleaning powder you sprinkle when you have something to cover up, and by the end of the stay it was making us gag. Next, the fitness center is a joke, with a few Elipticals in a hallway. Finally, the room, suite #101, was right next to the service elevator, and starting around 7 or 8 in the morning it was impossible to sleep. We complained, and they pretended that over the last 100 years nobody ever complained about the noisiness of this room. Please. After just coming from the Four Seasons in Lisbon where the service was impecable, this was not satisying. There are other nice hotels in Madrid. I would NOT stay in the Ritz again. Go there for afternoon tea in their outside garden if you can afford it, which is lovely, but don't stay there

Reviews.Title: “Best in Madrid - but some flaws”
Reviews.Author: skisunpeter
Reviews.Content: A really super Belle Epoque hotel. Over the years for business in Madrid have staid scores of nights if not weeks. For years the hotel has been in need of updating and it always seems to be in progress. While "classic" the lounge and common areas still are a bit tired As for rooms hit and miss - make sure you do not get an interior room (small dark dungeon) if you get a room facing the Prado really super views. With all of that said still the best hotel in Madrid - classy great location and beautiful property. Have spent 2-3 Christmas holidays with my family (adjoining rooms) and it was superb. Palace is big but institutional, Santo Mauro (faux modern condo hotel) - Villa Magna (upscale Hyatt).

Reviews.Title: “Low key luxury hotel”
Reviews.Author: METyler58
Reviews.Content: Five nights. Professional, friendly staff. Excellent location - near the three main museums/galeries and the Retiro Park (for running). Sensibly priced flight/hotel package via British Airways holidays (including breakfast). Good size room with all amenities (and a terrific shower!). Did not use the restaurant in the evening. Thoroughly recommended if you are looking for a luxury break and are willing to pay that bit extra for quality.

Reviews.Title: “Services for Drink 1*”
Reviews.Author: peterm1973
Reviews.Content: I have to say that we went to the Hotel Ritz only for a drink before diner elsewhere. First impression of the building (Lobby, bar, etc,) was very good. Then we sat down and waited for the waiter to take our order. Altough there were 4 to 5 employees that walked "around" none of them came to us to take our order. After 15 minutes we stood up end left this hotel without having a drink. I do not know whether waiting more then 15 minutes is normal but in a 5* hotel with very high prices (EUR 9.20 for a coffe, EUR 11.2 for a coke, about EUR 15 for a Baily's or more then EUR 20.- for most cocktails) that's not the way that I expect to be treated. The rooms and other services I can not rate but Lobby and Bar are a part of the Hotel and should also get sometimes a review.

Reviews.Title: “Old school glamour, ok rooms”
Reviews.Author: EmiliaS
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on a quick business trip. Location is not the most convenient so ended up using taxis a fair bit to get around from there. The lobby area is very nice old school glamour, concierge and check-in staff provided good service. Nice lobby restaurant environment, standard snack food. Rooms were tastefully furnished in old world style. Size-wise pretty small, had a view onto the court yard. Amenities were good. Would recommend to business travellers, but not necessarily for people on a city break looking to explore Madrid as the location wasn't ideal.

Reviews.Title: “I was expectig a ot more form THE RITZ MADRID”
Reviews.Author: grasshopergreen
Reviews.Content: It is a very nice place with nice history and a Royal fealing, unfortunately it looks like they havent invest a dime!, the place is folling apart and the service is not THAT good. I left my room at 9am and when I came back at 2pm my bed was still undone!, not what you expect from a 5 star luxury hotel, I have to say it was not the cleaning ladies fault, they where more than nice with me but it just seams like they havnt got enogh men power to give the service one expects from this kind of hotel!. The restaurant was nice, and overall its a good hotel, but I think is definitly lacking value for money! A shame with all the history and the lovely building

Reviews.Title: “Would love to give it a 5, but rooms need updating”
Reviews.Author: NYCBOS
Reviews.Content: The service was excellent, some of the best outside Asia. The concierge staff were helpful and extremely knowledgeable. The front desk staff was also very friendly and willing to go the extra step to make you feel comfortable. The service is so good, it nearly makes up for the sub-par rooms. The rooms are small and very dated. The rooms are in desperate need of remodeling. The food was very good, and the ambiance of the outdoor terrace is terrific. The hotel is perfectly situated for tourists. Overall, I would definitely recommend this hotel, especially to tourists who plan to spend much of their day outside of their room.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay at the Ritz”
Reviews.Author: StefiPrat
Reviews.Content: We had the most enchanting week end at the Ritz Hotel for my husband birthday. This is a truly five star hotel, when you can find elegance, tradition, exquisite manners, discrete and attentive service, care, attention and charming atmosphere. The room was beautiful with a lovely view of the Prado, ancient furniture, orchids and fresh fruit each day; breakfast was delicious, service was perfect. We cannot pick a better hotel in town.

Reviews.Title: “Wow, this was bad”
Reviews.Author: The_Traveler_011
Reviews.Content: I'm in the air every 2 weeks or so I travel quite a bit across the world. Almost always, I stay in a Westin, Ritz, Four Seasons, St. Regis, etc. I typically stay in the Westin in Madrid but decided to try the Ritz. Unbelievable, what a terrible place. Staff were generally uninterested, but you see that sometimes; however, the conditions of the room was just appalling. This was the only hotel I've stayed in that I actually wore my shoes in the room because I did not want my feet on the carpet. It was dirty and old; managment need to really sort this place out. Just awful.

Reviews.Title: “Not Orient-Express Caliber”
Reviews.Author: jhkester
Reviews.Content: Yes this hotel is historical and yes it's right next-door to El Prado, but it's offensive that they charge so much for a dirty, poorly-managed hotel in disrepair. We arrived to one bed instead of two in a cramped room, our dirty room carpet had a massive rip through it, our room had a view of a green courtyard with assorted generic flowerpots, and the doorman and concierge seemed utterly uninterested in getting us taxis or our keys. The mini-bar and room-service prices are an insult, even for mini-bar and room-service prices. I've stayed at other Orient-Express properties that have been wonderful (Ubud Hanging Gardens in Bali, Indonesia is one of the greatest hotels on earth). But this hotel has problems that an airport Hilton doesn't. We initially chose the Ritz because it seemed historical and we thought we could trust the Orient-Express name. Having explored Madrid, we'd stay at The Westin Palace looks to be the lovingly-restored property we had hoped the Ritz would have been.

Reviews.Title: “A fabulous part of history.”
Reviews.Author: TxTree
Reviews.Content: Our family of four stayed at the Ritz for three nights in November 2010. I thoroughly enjoyed the old-world, luxurious feel of the hotel. I understand why a few other travelers might have been disappointed - some of the fixtures and furnishings could use updating. Still, despite the signs of age, the quality of the accommodations is so much better and more refined that what you would find at almost any other modern five star hotel. The bed and bath linens are incredible. I think another reviewer commented on the gorgeous custom wardrobes - definitely a step back in time! The service is spectacular - we were attended to promptly, graciously and efficiently. The location is wonderful - having tea at the Ritz followed by a jaunt through the Prado - a perfect afternoon.

Reviews.Title: “Olde worlde experience”
Reviews.Author: Maxing-n-Relaxing
Reviews.Content: The Ritz was certainly an 'olde worlde' type 5-star hotel experience, including use of large room keys rather than swipe cards! The decor is 'traditional' style and the service level was high - with many courteous staff on hand at check-in. On entering the hotel three doormen from different sides each immediately greeted me. The decor showed its age in places, having seemingly been in place for a long time and repainted many times. The bathroom was rather small for a 5-star hotel and some of the fittings looked decades old. However, the towels were thick and the biggest I've come across - at double the size of a regular large bath towel. On the plus side, the room had absolute silence and was completely dark with the curtains drawn, helping to ensure a good night's sleep. A selection of pillow types was available, which housekeeping delivered to the room on request. The in-room Sony LCD TV (seemingly the most modern part of the hotel) had a large number of channels including ones in English (with BBC, ITV and some Sky channels), German and Spanish. There was also a DVD player and the hotel held a large selection of DVDs that could be delivered to the room on request. Room service was some of the most expensive I've encountered but I found the quality of the food well below par. My expensive evening meal was undercooked and poorly presented and the worst part of my stay. Overall, it was an interesting experience staying at the Ritz (rather than just a night in a hotel) and I don't regret sampling it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Grand Old Dame.”
Reviews.Author: TravelbugX50
Reviews.Content: This is the second time this year that we stayed at tThe Ritz, Madrid.Everything went as smooth as expected each time. We arrived in the afternoon by car and was professionally check-in with out delay. That evening they had a Jazz night by the garden terrace which was a wonderful performance by the singer,which we could hear from our room window,but we were too tired from our driving trip from the French boarder and wanted an early night. Its a pitty the next night we were told there would be no music as its only one night a week performance. Everything of the hotel including the service was of professional five star quality. However,coming from the East,we were accustomed to being treated at a more personal level of service from this level of establishment that is not usually find in the West,we learn to take it in stride. Overall, we find the Ritz an excellent choice that for its grandeau and professional service ,and its location is ideal to explore the center of Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Super location - old school service excellent - some dissapointments”
Reviews.Author: SummerhouseKent
Reviews.Content: The service and attention was all you would expect. Arriving early we were accommodated without fuss: showering after a long train journey, the towels were changed before we returned from a late lunch and regularly thereafter. Wonderful linen sheets changed daily and a spacious bed made a comfortable stay in a large room. The hostess in the restaurant was a little remote and had limited English, but we had a wonderful meal as part of the Art Package and a dreadful afternoon tea. Silly I suppose to do that (but it was included) in a city where tapas and a good bar is easy to find and fits better with the rhythm of the day. I am a Coeliac and brought my own “bread” but was served corn crackers and a small stale cake. I had to ask for something to go with them and got ham and smoked salmon after half an hour – an ugly picnic rather than the delicious and stylish event we had at the Dorchester in London (who catered for me discretely and with flair). The fragrance that is puffed into the stairways constantly made me sneeze! However we adored the linen, the location near the park and the 3 museums and the chauffeur car from the train (Elipsos) and to the airport. Value? Yes – but probably not with the add on package. Old school style – charming “belle epoque” furnishings and hand made carpets, but this suggests elderly aunt rather than modern luxe. Perhaps this is their market – it is an iconic building and much revered in Madrid as an institution – 100 years old this year .

Reviews.Title: “Faultless”
Reviews.Author: GurpalLondon_England
Reviews.Content: I booked the Ritz as a surprise for my wife for our 25th wedding anniversary. To keep the surprise going we got to the Ritz from the airport by using the Airport Express service (only 2 Euros per person), the bus stop is walking distance from the hotel. We were greeted by friendly and welcoming staff. Reception staff member TIAGO was excellent he arranged for a special treat for us when we returned to the hotel from our day out: chocolates, chilled bottle of cava, flowers and a mini anniversary cake. Our three day stay was faultless, the concierge staff were helpful, our room was cleaned daily, fresh bedding sheets, fresh fruit and two bottles of water. Buffet breakfast was excellent in addition you can order eggs to be cooked as you want them. The Spanish omellette was heavy going. The Ritz is situated near the centre and most places are walking distance. Take the Madrid tour from bus stops near the hotels, there are two two routes for the price of 17.20 Euros. It is a hop on hop off service. Being a non smoker the only small criticism I have is the smell of tobacco. Madrid people are heavy smokers and they do smoke in restaurants and bars. Other than that it was really enjoyable three night stay. I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Our worse experience ever!”
Reviews.Author: susanthompson100
Reviews.Content: The last hotel in our 14 days in southern Spain and quite a disappointment, to say the least. We booked this hotel after much consideration primarily due to its affiliation with the Leading Hotels of the World. Yes, we knew that it was an older property, but after the 4 days we had spent in Sevilla at the Alfonso XIII, we were looking forward to our stay at the Madrid Ritz. First impression was that the lobby, halls and rooms smelled of perfume, old perfume. It was as if the vents were pumping the fragrance in everywhere. If you have ever gone into an Abercrombie and Fitch store in the U.S., you will understand (except that the smell was more of a moth ball fragrance). Check in was normal, however, no mention of our membership in the Leading Hotels, or any of the amenities that we normally receive. Room was on the top floor, down multiple halls, with a view of an ugly wall about 20 feet away from the window. A/C did not work well so we were forced to open the window to get some fresh air. The free wi fi was non existent and I was forced to sit in a tiny cubicle to check in for our flights and check email which took about 45 minutes. There were many other people in and out of the business center with the same issue. (The business center was 2 cubicles with computers almost as old as the hotel). We were unable to log into the wi fi in our room or lobby with either our mobile phones or laptop. Overall, we felt like we were completely ripped off, truthfully. We stayed in 5 star hotels our entire time in Spain and the Ritz Madrid never compared to one in any way. Stay clear unless you are looking for a stuffy, old, overpriced hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel but needs renovating and more staff”
Reviews.Author: Anglotraveller
Reviews.Content: Loved the feel and location of the hotel, staff very friendly, knowledgable and helpful. However, all the staff were overworked and sometimes it would take time to get a response. We a nice city view delux room but it was shabby and in need of an upgrade, but it was a nice size.

Reviews.Title: “a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: CassGeorge
Reviews.Content: we stayed at the Ritz for 4 nights recently and absolutely loved the hotel. What really stood out for us was the extremely high level of service. From the moment we arrived to the time we left, every interaction was friendly, helpful and most importantly not stuffy or formal. We had a beautiful room on the 5th floor overlooking the Prado, and the hotel is perfectly located for sightseeing. Drinks and a light meal in the beautiful garden with live music was a highlight. The hotel is grand, elegant but yet manages to be relaxed and friendly, the conceirge was incredibly helpful. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Not Ritzy at All”
Reviews.Author: Kellie18_10
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Ritz Madrid for 3 nights. We are very familiar with Ritz Hotels, as we stay with work in London twice a year and have spent time in the Paris Ritz. We chose the Ritz Madrid thinking it was as lovely as London or Paris Hotels. Unfortunately, the main areas of Ritz Madrid is incredibly tired. Our room was okay, but the bathroom had a very strange configuration, the shower was tiny and my husband had a problem fitting into the toilet cubicle. The walls are not so soundproofed as we could hear the neighbouring rooms during the night. The breakfast was expensive and after telling the woman in the breakfast room we were only having the Fitness Breakfast, (we were told it was included in our room rate), knowing it wasn't we told her to take note as we were not eating the Buffet Breakfast. On checkout they had charged us for Buffet. This hotel needs quite a bit of work to catch up to its London and Parisian name sakes and the staff need to learn about service and finesse. The location was excellent right next to the Prada Gallery.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: Chicagolikes2travel
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a week for business/leisure. The location is perfect. In addition to the museums, Retiro Park is a short walk away. If you have the time, take a stroll thru the grounds, they are beautiful. As other reviewers noted (so I can't say I was surprised), the rooms need updating. We prefer staying at older hotels. However, they could take a tip or two from properties like the Hotel des Bergues in Geneva, which is historical and has updated classical accommodations. Service was very good. Reservations, housekeeping, room service and the doorman were excellent. We didn't have much luck with the concierge. Perhaps it was because our Spanish is pretty rusty, we had a hard time communicating. Weather permitting, make sure you have dinner/drinks on the Terrace. The weather in Madrid was absolutely gorgeous while we were there and this was the perfect place to enjoy a drink before dinner.

Reviews.Title: “Muy bien”
Reviews.Author: michelle_weissbart
Reviews.Content: A hotel that's not just in old Europe, but is of old Europe. Full of charm, though a little bit tired. The concierge couldn't be more helpful and the location couldn't be more ideal—right around the corner from the Prado, as well as other main attractions. We got shafted with a runt of a room. In fact, I kept banging into stuff in the bathroom because it was so small. Guess that's what you get on the corporate rate. Fair enough. If you're booking ong a special price, be sure to request preferences in advance. All in all, the Ritz Madrid is a classic hotel in the heart of an incredible city. Michelle Weissbart NYC

Reviews.Title: “Decadent hotel and wonderful service”
Reviews.Author: Pyes
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with my children and Mother in a suite on the top floor. It was beautiful and spacious. The drawing room was especially beautiful. Circular in shape and full of antiques and paintings. The two bedrooms leading from the hallway were of an excellent size and the general standard of the rooms very high. It had an orient express feeling about it - very charming. I would recommend the hotel to my friends, however it does need updating. The carpets and the bathrooms especially require attention, although both adequately cleaned and looked after. However the service of this hotel is second to none, and the staff are truly world class. Both professional and courteous we were very happy to be well care for here. The afternoon tea is a must, in a glorious dining room it feels as if you have just stepped back in time. We did think the hotel should ask the tourists to take their baseball hats off and keep the noise down to a polite level, they really ought to make an effort to blend into such elegant surroundings. Although I appreciate there is only so much that can be done, but a gentle dress code would be fitting. The hotel is quite small, but in a very good location. We enjoyed our stay and would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Real top Luxe!”
Reviews.Author: ocanoa
Reviews.Content: A classical Ritz Hotel, one of the best ones in the world. Maybe a bit expensive if not enjoying a special package.... I went there for a wedding and took the opportunity to spend the night with a special rate....Wonderful! The location is also perfect: close to the best 3 national museums of Madrid, the Prado, Reina Sofia and the Thyssen. Also, walking distance from the Retiro Park and the old city center. Perfect to enjoy a romantic Week End, better to go in Spring/August to avoid the high temperatures of the Spanish Summer (over 33C in July/August)

Reviews.Title: “Overrated!”
Reviews.Author: Laur2d
Reviews.Content: There's old and charming and then there's just old- this hotel looks old, like they can't afford to update the rooms. I booked a luxury room and package for 5 nights with my husband and two small children. Upon arrival our room was not prepared as reserved, although this was quickly resolved and otherwise housekeeping did a good job. Beds are not very comfortable. Breakfast buffet was good but service was horrible some days, great others. Bellmen and front desk very pleasant, concierge okay. Overall, I didn't feel the service and especially the room quality warranted the price. I expected to feel like I was staying somewhere special and just felt like I'd overpayed. I'd have done just as well at a hotel that charged half as much.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel and excellent service”
Reviews.Author: Nivlam
Reviews.Content: We had actually booked two stays at the Hotel Ritz, but our first stay happened to be the day after the "Fire In the Kitchen", which another reviewer noted, and the entire hotel had to shut down. My only complaint was that, although they claimed to have tried to contact us, neither us nor our friends that we were traveling with received a call or message. We only found out when we called for our airport transfer. They put us instead in the Gran Melia Fenix, which we felt was far inferior to the Ritz. Upon our return to Madrid at the end of our vacation, we were upgraded to a junior suite for our previous troubles and the staff were all extremely friendly and helpful. The view was amazing and of course, the location of the hotel itself can't be beat. The outdoor terrace restaurant was lovely and we even enjoyed our afternoon tea, although the server wasn't very accommodating to Americans who don't normally do a formal tea service (but we laughed it off!). Overall, a wonderful experience - we only wished we could've stayed there both times we had planned.

Reviews.Title: “FIRE IN THE KITCHEN”
Reviews.Author: spencerstuart
Reviews.Content: The night of July 18-19, the hotel was evacuated due to a fire......imagine someone screaming in spanish pounding on your door at 0130.......smoke in the hallways......no alarm, no intercom, no warning, no nothing. all guests were rushed with whatever we could wear to the street outside while madrid fire and police went to work........I had a flight at 0850 that morning so I really needed to access my belongings and go....I was escorted to my room by two madrid cops with flashlights as I crammed my stuff into my bag and left amid a mosaic of media, flashing lights and sirens...........old world grandeur for sure but lacking new world safety.

Reviews.Title: “Old World elegance”
Reviews.Author: Potatofairy
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Ritz for one night on a brief business trip. It was also the night that Athletico Madrid reached the semi final of the Europa cup. It was hard not to get caught up in the enthuasiasm of the supporters, I hadn't realised that the square outside the Hotel was the meeting point for celebrations! I checked in very late in the evening and the night desk staff were swift and very welcoming. The room wasn't too big but beautifully furnished in the old European style but with all modern amenities that you require when travelling for work and plenty of wall sockets for plugging in lots of gadgets. The bed was very comfortable, beautiful linens, it was just unfortunate that the celebrations went into the night and every citizen of Madrid (and their car) where outside. However, it was all very good natured and not the fault of the hotel. Breakfast the following morning was excellent, service was well up to 5 * standard. It's also next door to the Prado Museum ( a definite plus when you only have 10 minutes to see a Velasquez!)

Reviews.Title: “THE BEST HOTEL EVER”
Reviews.Author: morado_10
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed very much our stay. Everything did complement each other: the decoration style, the excellent service, their restaurants menus and the deluxe rooms. I believe this hotel after 100 years still is at the top in Spain and Europe. Great location on the hart of Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: coloradofoodmaven
Reviews.Content: This hotel has it all. Old world grandeur with flat screen TVs. Incredible service that is among the best we have had. You can get packages with breakfast, airport transfer, breakfast, internet that actually make it a good value.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: EWLTexas
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent three nights at the Ritz Hotel in early May 2010, and loved it. It is beautifully decorated in a “turn of the century” style, has friendly staff (especially the concierge desk) and a wonderful afternoon tea. We made our reservation there through the American Express Platinum Travel Program, which has always (for us) provided wonderful upgrades at their “Fine Hotels and Resorts” and this was no exception. We were assigned to what the hotel described as a “small” suite but, in reality, turned out to be impressively large with separate bedroom and living room on the fifth floor (# 515) overlooking the Prado Museum. The Ritz is located in a prime location close to Retiro Park and the major museums. The Prado Museum across the street has recently been renovated and brightened to the point that it makes the nearby Thyssen-Bornemisza Museum look dated. Also within easy walking distance are the scenic plazas of the old town and the Royal Palace (rent the audio guide and do not miss the armory). We were even able to walk to the Sorolla Museum and the newly renovated Museo Romantico, both often overlooked gems.

Reviews.Title: “Truly five star experience in the heart of Old Madrid”
Reviews.Author: Stvitus
Reviews.Content: This hotel which is a part of the Orient express hotel experience is situated in a beautiful part of old Madrid and is ideally located in the immediate vicinity of the major museum attractions of the Prado and the Thyssen. Its a charming building with an impressive and ornate lobby. The staff here are very helpful and can converse in English and are very accomodative. The Ritz's rooms are well proportioned and exhibit a romantic old world charm. The in-house dinning experience is a treat with a terrace restaurant that caters to hotel guests to some tasteful delights. All in all a very satisfying stay. Will return.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel”
Reviews.Author: Simange
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel in december 2009. The hotel is a beautiful old building, near all the most important museums. The service is simply perfect. The tea in the lobby is an unforgettable experience. My room (de luxe city w) was perfect and wasn't old, as others tripadvisors said. If you're looking for a modern hotel, if you love contemporary art, you don't stay at the ritz.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, but rooms are old”
Reviews.Author: Ribakit
Reviews.Content: This is one of the best in the city. I had a room overlooking Prado Museum. Rooms are spacious, but look a liitle bit old and tired. The service is great. People in Madrid more often recommend Westin.

Reviews.Title: “Don't bother to stay there! Waste of money!”
Reviews.Author: Little-Fruit-Bat
Reviews.Content: This is another of those old hotels which survive on their name but which should undergo major changes starting with new management. The service is bad, starting with unfriendly staff at the reception who don't even bother to explain the basics such as breakfast time and services available to guests. They only clean rooms in the afternoon which is late for international standards. The quality of food offered for breakfast, for which you pay 38 Euro, is poor, they must be saving money judging by the sub-standard ham (Hamon Iberico) and all the rest. Please don't go for room service as I did, the cook should be fired. They brought sticky, cold pasta and the worst chips I ever had - it shouldn't be too difficult to prepare chips, one would think. Yes, unless you use a low-quality cheap product to start with. And what about laundry? They want 18 euros to wash a shirt, 17 euros for a trouser, 10 euros for panties, 10 euros for one pair of socks, just to mention a few. Save the money and buy new clothes! I cannot believe that this hotel is among the "Leading hotels of the world". So do a favour to yourself and stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “A memorable stay in a place where history wraps up the perfection of service”
Reviews.Author: Doctor G 06
Reviews.Content: There's likely little to add to the hundreds of 5-stars comments already avalibale on this site. I chose this hotel because it was the site of an event I wished to attend, so that I took the opportunity to extend the occasion for a visit of the beautiful Madrid with my family. E-mail reservation was efficient, although a bit less formal than expected ( no matter on practical grounds). Then everything was about perfect. The belle epoque style has nothing of oldish; on the contary , everything is efficient and mantled by an unique atmospehere that only the tradition of the greatest histiory can offer. The atmosphere is of supreme elegance, softness and comfort. Nothing is missing, nothing is excessive. The numerous people necessarily working to keep eveything to such a level of order are almost invisible; in the rare occasions you meet them, they smile and know you by family name, respectfully showing they really care. The afternoon tea with background piano music is an experience by itself. Breakfast and dinner in a relaxing subdued light offer remarkable kitchen delights. The concierge service was prompt in efficiently meeting any informatìion and reservation request. I found myself remembering this recent 4-days Madrid holiday several times and a serene smile came up to my face. Many still smoke in Spain. Just remember to ask for a room in a non-smoking floor ( if you like it)

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel and great service”
Reviews.Author: Oh_my_Yulia
Reviews.Content: Location, view, atmosphere, food....everything high class, this is Ritz! Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “GREAT HOTEL, BUT WE EXPECTED MORE..."”
Reviews.Author: CasalTaListo
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, great location (just beside Prado Museum), great food, but service could be better. people dont know your name, sometimes take too long to get to you and arent that helpful. We expected more, as long as it is a Ritz and you are paying more than U$ 400 a night. If you must choose a 5 star hotel, prefer a Four Season..

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location, good service, but the place is a bit tired”
Reviews.Author: linusbos
Reviews.Content: I agree with many other reviewers that this special, historic and grand hotel could use a little facelift (the carpets!). Nevertheless our room was very spacious and clean. The service is generally quite good but was a bit spotty at the Garden Terrace. The location is ideal – just behind the Prado. One last thing – at these prices one should not charge for WiFi.

Reviews.Title: “Great Weekend”
Reviews.Author: GN&CB
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights last week to celebrate a friends 50th birthday. I booked the special offer rate several months in advance, so got a really good deal for room only. We were situated on the first floor looking towards the courtyard. Part of our bedroom window was 'obstructed' by the way the courtyard is designed, so there was no particular view. If we had paid full rate for the room, I would probably have asked to be moved. As it was, it did not impact upon our stay. The room was large, clean and well serviced, and will benefit from refurbishment in due course as others have mentioned. We received complimentary water, cake and fruit each day. We found the service to be good. I had booked a couple of restaurants in advance, and we were given excellent tables when we attended. No problems with taxi's, although it is obviously a quite time of year in Madrid for tourists. Prices in the hotel are high, so watch out. Overall a very enjoyable stay in a classic hotel. If youre eating out La Capilla de la Bolsa is an absolute must ! We had a fantastic evening.

Reviews.Title: “the best hotel - luxury, ancient flavour and excellent service”
Reviews.Author: pilar_ramonicortasa
Reviews.Content: I celebrated my wedding there. And the arrangements, customer focus, service, quality of food, attention, details... were so extremely well managed that you could not believe it. The menus are excepcional.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and good service”
Reviews.Author: bighead33
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Ritz for the New Year, overall the stay was good but it leaves a lot to be desired from a Hotel of this class. The attention to service was good but not excellent, several times we had to walk to the corner because they were unable to get us a taxi. Also on the day we left, we call several times to get help with the baggage but no one arrived. The concierge and check in staff were OK, but nothing more than that. The rooms are VERY dated, there condition are good, but how many coats of paint can you put on a door before you need to changed it? The carpets, beds and bathrooms show their age. I need to point out that the room was HUGE y European standards. I will stay here again but only once it has been remolded.

Reviews.Title: “Opulent, grand & fantastic location. Love it.”
Reviews.Author: MissMartinih
Reviews.Content: I stayed there last week for a night with my partner. We were given a room in the third floor with views over the courtyard but said courtyard is green, ample and very quiet and we were on a business trip so it wasn't a big deal to us.. We are quite young (late 20s) and found the almighty Ritz to be an opulent, beautiful grand hotel. We had concerns as we had been told stories of snobby staff (this must be the ultimate sin the service industry in my opinion, but then Spain is not a service-orientated country) and a garish deco in need of an update but we found its decadence and opulence very uplifting and somehow entertaining. Good Points; Great location for a visit to Madrid's most accomplished museums and other leisure activities, great service, complimentary cakes and bottled water in the room, spacious wardrobes and baths, lush heavy robes and good beds. Bad Points: Lacked some toiletries I'd expected to find such as a toothbrush or a shaving kit and the body bream had noticeably been used and most annoyingly the room service kept attempting to clean the room even though my partner, who had left early to work, had indicated that I would be sleeping in the room. In one occasion they didn't even knock on the door before entering which I found really odd. They did profusely apologized for this in reception and it could have helped to hang the 'do not disturb' sign so it's all forgiven and I would most definitely go back anytime. I'll have to add that the garden's terrace is nothing special (Dear management: underground smelly toilets are a no-no) and the prices are insultingly high in relation to the quality of the service/food given.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, excellent service”
Reviews.Author: LeighCole
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ritz our first two nights in Spain. The location by the Prado and the Thyssen-Bornemisza is perfect, and it is within comfortable walking distance of central Madrid. The service was outstanding (though not great in the otherwise lovely garden bar), especially for Spain, which is not a service-oriented country. The concierges were about as good as any we have dealt with in Europe (except for Paris). Our room was clean, quiet, and comfortable, with a lovely view over the Plaza de la Lealtad. Our only cavil is that the hotel could stand to be freshened up. Some furnishings in the room and in the public spaces were a little tired. Overall, this was an elegant hotel that we would gladly stay at again, most especially because of the location and service.

Reviews.Title: “Worth considering”
Reviews.Author: WJN58
Reviews.Content: Convenient location, excellent service, rooms a bit old fashioned/dated, some variety for breakfast desirable (same buffet for the 5 consecutive mornings). Continuous VIP events with associated security and police presence may make the stay a tad uncomfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great hotel, needs to get some little things right”
Reviews.Author: Valiant2
Reviews.Content: I travelled for a long weekend in Madrid with my wife and teenage children. We had two adjoining rooms. Both rooms were pleasant, clean, roomy and with great bathrooms. Check in was smooth, baggage delivery seamless, and everything personally explained. The location of this hotel is perfect for visiting Madrid: next to the Prado and Thyssen museums; lots of taxis; close to the regular and tourist bus stops, and reasonably close to the Metro. Generally we had a great time, making use of the large hall and having the magnificent, truly magnificent Sunday "brunch" (only in Spain could brunch start at 1330!) and one evening meal in the Goya restaurant - faultless really. Housekeeping was fine; one night they forgot to trun down the kids' room, but maybe they thought someone was in there ... On some other occasions, particularly in the Garden Terrace, service seemed quite sloppy. I had to get up and go and ask to be served on one occasion, and this wasn't an isolated incident. Having said that the Concierge and Door staff are First Rate. The hotel is very expensive, but you're paying for the location and the grandeur. (Do they really have to charge an extra 22 Euros a night for Wifi access ..?) This being my second Ritz visit, I'd find it very difficult to stay anywhere else in Madrid now.

Reviews.Title: “The Grand Old Lady of Madrid slightly losing her charm and touch.”
Reviews.Author: AmsterdamFrancis
Reviews.Content: When staying at the world renowned Ritz Hotel, you expect everything to be perfect, but alas... We stayed at the Ritz for three nights. The reservation, made via the hotel website, was for a de luxe room with city view. Arrival and check-in: Upon arrival by taxi from the airport, there was nobody at the door to greet us and help with the luggage: The doormen were very busy with guests arriving in a private limo. First impressions count... Check-in went smoothly and we headed off to our room (unaccompanied) on the 6th floor. It was a very dark, small room with courtyard view. As we booked a room with city view, this couldn't be the right room. The check in clerk apologised and changed the room, but we had to wait for over half an hour before it was ready. During that time, the drinks were on the house. The check-in clerk accompanied us to our room, on the second floor. The room: A nice, spacious and well appointed room, with small hallway, two large cupboards, a small desk, one easy chair, a big bathroom with two sinks, bath, a separate shower and separate WC, The view was absolutely great: Overlooking the Prado Museum. The positives of the room: The wonderful view, the comfortable beds and completey sound proof when the windows were closed. Satellite tv with 50+ channels. Free internet was part of our package and worked perfectly fine. The negatives: Renovation going on in the next room: Very noisy during the daytime. The a/c made a very loud banging and humming sound. Fortunately, the weather was such that we didn't have to use it. Room and bathroom quite dark. Shower had no light and the big showerhead was quite low, so all in all rather claustrofobic. The separate WC was so small, that even a person of average height like myself couldn't properly sit down.. Slightly too many negatives for the price you have to pay... Restaurant: Breakfast buffet was included. As we went down to have breakfast the first morning (Friday) at apr. 9.00, we had to wait our turn to get into the restaurant and it took about 20 minutes!!! Absolutely unheard of to have to be standing in line for such a period of time. They should have opened the annex as well, as they did the following days. Buffet was very good, with an abundance of choice. The next two days we had an early breakfast at 07.30, so no problem getting a table. The lobby/bar is opulent, but not very cosy. Bright lights and a little too "posh" to our taste. Walk to the (Westin)Palace Hotel across the square and have a drink in their beautiful lobby-bar with glass-stained dome. Absolutely lovely! Staff and concierges: The first night the concierge couldn't find our roomkey when we returned to the hotel. It took him 10 minutes to find it and afterwards he practically blamed us for not having it placed in the right keybox when leaving the hotel. He really had an arrogant attitude. All in all however, staff were courteous and friendly. In many reviews I read about the fact that the concierges and doormen knew the guests by their name, but not in our case: many times we had to tell them our name and roomnumber. In most hotels they offer umbrella's when it's raining, but there didn't seem to be any available, or the concierges and doormen were unwilling to give them out. I gave up, after asking for an umbrella twice. Housekeeping very good. Clean sheets every day, twice a day towel change and of course turn-down service. The second day we got a fruit basket and found a small complimentary bottle of water next to our bedsides. Probably because of the room change, such was forgotten the first day.
