Overall: The first morning when we opened the windows, we were startled by very loud noises from the street. It turned out to be from protesters holding a demonstration at the hotel entrance, from 08.00 till 22.00. They were former employees of the hotel, who were laid off. The sound they made was deafening. It seems they hold such a protest once or twice a week! On the Sunday we were leaving, the finish of the Vuelta (cycling) was going to take place oppsite the hotel. Everything was closed around the hotel: Major roads, roadblocks everywhere etc. We had to leave very early for the airport, because taxi's were not allowed near the hotel after 10.00 am. It would have been nice to have been warned about this, when making the booking. All in all: The Ritz is still the Grand Old Lady of Madrid. Prices are very high and you expect everything to be in perfect order, but during our stay, there were too many flaws. The location of the hotel is perfect. Visit the Prado, Reina Sofia and/or Thyssen-Bornemiza Museums all within 5 to 8 minutes walking distance. Take the tourbus around the corner of the hotel, which will drive you through either "old" or "modern" Madrid, but beware: The city is undergoing major construction: Practically every major road is under construction! Still: Madrid is well worth a visit and the location of the Ritz can't be beaten. But also have a look at the other Grand Lady: The Palace Hotel

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel with amazing staff”
Reviews.Author: CaliforniaLori
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed here for one night at the end of our trip to Spain (we had stayed at the Westin Madrid Palace for two nights at the beginning of our trip) and we all wished that we had spent more time at this lovely hotel. We had two connecting rooms - a King connected to a double with two twin beds. Our rooms overlooked the Prado - which was a huge plus. The rooms are spacious and exude old world charm (photos posted) and the bathrooms are also quite large. The downside is that the shower stall is miniscule and very dark (there is no light in the shower stall) - a large person would be very uncomfortable in these showers. The staff are wonderful - friendly and anticipating every need. The hotel is pricey, but worth it if you can afford it. It is miles ahead of its neighbor the Westin.

Reviews.Title: “The Grand Dame of Madrid”
Reviews.Author: Gisymar
Reviews.Content: I honeymooned in Spain ten years ago and dreamed of staying at the grand Ritz Madrid. Since then I have traveled to Spain multiple times and have taken pictures of the hotel from the outside and always took a peek in the lobby during my visits, but could never afford to stay. Regardless, I felt as though the Ritz was always my polite welcome to the sleepless city I am forever dreaming of. However, this time around I waltzed into the marble clad lobby and was greeted like an old friend by the bellman and was welcomed by the front desk as though he had secretly known I had waited ten years for this stay. I felt humbled to be there. As I checked into room 603 and carefully inspected my awaiting home away from home, I couldn't help but notice that although still grand - my great dame of Madrid seemed tired, worn and in need of an gentle update. Although everything was spotless and the staff was wonderful, the hotel, and I understand these are challenging economic times, needs a little tlc. I hope the Ritz is careful in taking care of this delicate city heirloom. The hotel has a presence that is so fine, so unique that a restoration not done with care can unleash the years of carefully developed historical patina. Aside from that, what can I say that hasn't been said already? The location is magical! Retiro Park and the Prado are a stone throw away. You can walk to great food on Huertas and spectacular boutique shopping in Salamanca is just down the road (although be forewarned Salamanca’s Calle Serrano seems to be in major construction!) This is a truly Spanish city- austere yet restless, modern yet classic. Each street unfolds a new story an unwritten adventure and a favorite hidden gem. This is Madrid. I close my eyes and wish I was there.

Reviews.Title: “Glamorous with perfectly trained staff but rooms could do with an update”
Reviews.Author: griseldis
Reviews.Content: I spent 3 nights in a standard room at the Ritz Madrid in August. I had a pleasant stay. Below, my report as follows: The room: furnished classic style with dark furniture (a desk with a chair, a cabinet with a Sony-flat-screen TV on top (access to BBC/CNN), a seat, a large comfortable bed with 2 bedside-tables, decorated in dark yellow-gold-burgundy shades. There were also 2 large wardrobes in the room, one with a number of drawers inside (and huge enough to hold my trolley), the other one contained the safe and a bar with hangers). The minibar was next to the entrance door on the right. Everything looked nice apart from the carpet which appeared a little worn. There were lots of switches on the walls and I found the lighting of the room quite confusing to operate. The bathroom: grey marble, 2 sinks, a tub with a shower curtain. A door separated this room from a smaller one with the bidet and the toilet in it . Behind the door there were hooks with two bathrobes (I found 2 pairs of fluffy white slippers in the wardrobe on top of the drawers). I was given 2 large thick bathtowels and a number of smaller ones per day. The toiletries were a mix of l Occitane (soap) and Bulgari (shampoo, shower gel, conditioner) and there were also shower caps and a small vanity-pack (Q-tips, plaster, etc.) The bathroom was well maintained and spotlessly clean. The golden veneer was partly rubbed off the taps and railings, though, which made the stainless steel underneath it become visible. As mentioned above my room faced the courtyard and was shadowy in the afternoon which turned out to be a blessing in the suffocating Madrid August heat. The courtyard is decorated with neatly arranged trees in flower pots, sitting on an artificial lawn carpet. As it was relatively cool in my room I could switch off the clima and leave the windows open all day and night. Apart from a soft humming sound (not noisier than the clima and probably comming from the fans) the atmospere was peaceful and I slept well. The staff: Well trained, most attentive and friendly but also keeping a certain distance without appearing aloof or condescending as they sometimes behave in the high-category hotels . (The concierge remembered my room number after just having met me once, when I stopped for a second on my way through the lobby thinking "Have I packed the camera ?" I was immediately approached by a staff member asking if he could help, when the maids learned that I used to spend most of the day in my room (thanks to the heat...) housekeeping service contacted me and suggested arranging the housekeeping routine according to my personal needs). Housekeeping was generally done so quietly in rooms and corridors next to me that I never felt disturbed during my presence (11 a.m.-16 p.m.) while I was reading, sleeping or watching TV. So if you are looking for a quiet comfortable place to relax in Madrid center, this hotel is for you. Advice: You can walk from the hotel to the historic part of Madrid; a stroll from the Ritz to the Royal Palace took me 30 minutes. Cross Paseo del Prado, walk over to the corner Thyssen museum/Plaza de las Cortes and just walk straight on to Plaza del Sol. Then make sure you follow the pedestrian mall Calle de Arenal and at Metro Opera, behind the Theatre, there is the Royal Palace. The Prado is situated directly behind the Ritz (3 minutes walk), best be there already at 9 a.m. or go at lunchtime. Fantastic masterpieces on show (El Greco made my day). Restaurants can be found at Calle de Alcala. When you leave the main entrance of the hotel, turn right and walk up the Paseo del Prado (always in the shadow thanks to the trees) to Plaza de la Cibeles, cross the Paseo del Prado and on the left side (where Bance de Espana is) walk a few metres and there are restaurants. I also had lunch once at a restaurant called "The WOK" on the opposite side of Calle de Alcala. It is at Metro Sevilla on Calle Virgen Peligro, behind the Starbucks and offers tasty little Asian meals for just 10-15 Euro. For hotel shuttle I used AeroCity shuttle service, I came across their counter in the arrival hall. I strongly recommend them, I bought my voucher at their counter at 46 Euro for the return ticket airport-hotel-airport. The mini vans have clima and the service is reliable. Their return shuttle van to the airport arrived at the Ritz on the dot.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: elviPortugal
Reviews.Content: Well, Ritz is Ritz and it fully justifies it`s name. Rooms are spacious and gorgeously decorated. Food is excellent. Lobby ambience is trully beautiful. And also the location is very convinient - you`ll have Prado museum just a few steps from the hotel. I`ve been there for buisness and enjoied my stay every minute.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: Dismayeddiner
Reviews.Content: After reading this review the reader may wonder why i have rated this hotel excellent, however read on: Our stay was for three nights. We arrived a little early and were greeted in a very friendly and proficient manner and offered a complimentary coffee whilst our room was being finalised. It was a comfortable room but with no view although we had requested a view. The carpet is approx. 24 years old and very worn and dirty. The slippers in the bedroom were most welcomed due mainly to the feel of the carpet. The crisp clean sheets, changed daily and turn down, very pleasant. The buffet breakfast differed in quality from day to day. Very watery scrambled eggs, cold bacon, no mushrooms or hash browns or baked beans or choice of eggs but the kitchen will prepare what you ask for. It was very pleasant sitting outside in the hotel garden........but took 27 minutes to be served a drink in the evening. Coffee is E10.00 and coke E11.00 and whisky from E20.00 but there are other hotels and restaurants which charge fairly similar prices. The concierge desk was extremely polite and helpful, nothing was too much trouble. It is a hotel you would really like to like but there was always something that seem to put you off. The quality of breakfast, the slowness of service, the high prices and the general feel that the hotel is past its best. It seems to be from a by gone era However, it is next to the Prado, the Thyssen, the Reina Sofia, the botanica gardens and is very quiet despite being so close to the centre. Would i stay there again? no. But there is something about it, you just wish it was better....newer..... and cleaner.

Reviews.Title: “Worth every Euro. Spacious room, fab linen sheets, great breakfast, perfect location, friendly helpful service.”
Reviews.Author: SandyArf
Reviews.Content: Splurge to have the Ritz car and driver meet you at the airpot. After an overnight flight, it is too much of a hassle to negotiate an airport. Then take an hour or so to unpack and refresh before enjoying a light lunch of gazpacho and Spanish white wine in the Garden Terrace. A walk in any direction will lead you to something fascinating and after a couple of hours walking, return to the hotel for a nap. Awaken for another walk to Plaza de Cibeles and follow Calle de Alcala to Puerto de Sol. Have dinner along the way at 9:00 or later , followed by a stroll to Plaza Mayor and Plaza de Santa Ana for a nightcap and you will be on the Spanish timetable for the rest of your trip. Return to the Ritz for a yummy chocolate and a dreamy night on crisp hand embroidered linen sheets. Awaken to a lovely breakfast buffet served until 11:00. Be sure to return in the afternoon for your nap and to enjoy your generous snack of cakes or fruits served on pretty plates with silverware and linen napkins. No cellophane wrapped corporate goody served here. True luxury is in the details of service to the guest in my opinion and this hotel graciously provided those details.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel,Big suites,Excelent service”
Reviews.Author: geo007
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Ritz Madri as part of a 34 nights/36 days Spain tour,after having stayed at Valencia,Cuenca,Zaragoza,Pamplona and San Sebastian.Arrived at the hotel by taxi from Madri Barajas Airport at 15hs00.The suite was not ready yet,so they offered lunch or the possibilitie of wait in another standard room.I prefered lunch.After 1 hour,M.Monica from the reception came and said that the suite was ready.It was located in the 4th floor,with views of the front square.The windows were soundproofed,the suite large,but the bathroom was huge,with towel warmers and Bulgari products.Two walk in closets,one for hanging clothes,the other even with a small sofa to sit while you choose what to wear... Breakfast was not included,and costs 32 Euros plus 7% tax.We didn't use the garage.Wi fi paid.Mordomo service to pack and unpack your luggage and put clothes,etc in the 2 closets. With no doubt when I come back to Madri I'll stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Formal Old World Charm”
Reviews.Author: nanicinema
Reviews.Content: We stayed only one night and mainly picked the hotel because of its location right next to the Prado. The location was great for us as we could walk to Retiro Park and the Prado. It was very hot during our stay but the hotel was very cool. The furniture was beautiful. Real antiques not reproductions, and the service was very professional and elegant. However, our 8 year old child says, "it was good for the most part but it was more a business hotel than a luxury vacation hotel." I would agree. The hotel reflected Madrid's elegant "stuffiness" - nothing wrong with that, as a matter a fact it might be just what you're looking for if you're traveling on business or as a couple, but as a family I'm not sure it was the best choice. We sort of knew that might be the case going into it and I have to say for the night we slept extremely well and we all thought it was an interesting experience. Interesting in a good way.

Reviews.Title: “Grand Luxury Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: CS-London
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in many world famous Grand Palace Hotels in Europe like the Dorchester in London, the Ritz and the Four Seasons Hotel George V in Paris, as well as, the St Regis Grand Hotel in Rome, the Hotel de Paris in Monte-Carlo and many more, and I can only say that the Hotel Ritz Madrid is equal to most of them. It is defently the most exclusive hotel in Madrid! Our elegant deluxe room on the 4th floor was lovely with breathtaking views of the Prado Museum. The magnificent public areas have restored original furniture and period antiques, original paintings and crystal chanteliers. The spectacular Goya Restaurant is one of the finest in Madrid, as well as the terrace and the gardens of the Ritz Hotel durring the summer. Perfect place for al fresco lunch or dinner at night. Best in Madrid. We loved it! The Ritz Madrid is defently the most prestigious address in Madrid. Few years ago I have stayed as well at Westin Palace which is a lovely deluxe hotel, but the Ritz Madrid is deffently exceptional. It is a truly original Ritz Grand Luxury Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Only Great Things to Say about the Ritz !!”
Reviews.Author: TexasTigerDallas
Reviews.Content: Father/daughter stay for three nights. The Hotel, staff, garden restaurant, and location helped us love our stay in Madrid. From celebrities checking in to the arrival of the President of the Dominican Republic, the Ritz was sophistication and class. We booked train reservations, a tour to the Escorial, the best disco in town (Kapital), and a fine restaurant through the concierge-muchas gracias Begona! All went without a hitch. We highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “top but overexpensive !”
Reviews.Author: t2803h
Reviews.Content: one of the best in europe ! gorgeous location close to the museums , huge plushy rooms !the terrace at night for a late supper is a dream ! but : expensive , very expensive, staff a bit distant ( the usual spanish approach ! ) if u can afford it , it's OK ! i strongly advise a more informal hotel close to chueca district : HOTEL SIETE ISLAS , 4 stars , but cheaper ! thierry , the frenchy , paris

Reviews.Title: “Just wonderful”
Reviews.Author: ChristineGrisel
Reviews.Content: I spent 3nights and 4 days at the Ritz. The Personnel is really very professional, efficient and helpful. They reserved tables in restaurants for us, helped with guided tours.... It is a true luxurious hotel & even though the colours on the carpets do look a bit faded what the heck, this is the mythical Ritz Hotel in Madrid after all. The hall, the restaurant and the staircase were much smaller than I thought but then perhaps it's better that way. The lounge is lovely and cosy for aperitifs, after dinner drinks (their Irish coffee is delicious, 16 euros) and for the scrumptious high tea (30 euros per person) , the only restaurant (used for breakfast too) is quite intimate, with silver cutlery. I would have liked the different cheeses to be named at the breakfast buffet to be able to buy the same back home. It’s a shame that there are no Spanish specialities available, (for breakfast & dinner) just international type food. For breakfast we wanted Serrano ham and we were charged 40 euros for one serving. Wi-fi costs 10 euros per hour or 16 euros per day. Go along to the many internet cafes around the area, 1 euro for 15 minutes. A big bottle of whisky or wine at the El Corte Ingles supermarkets will cost the same as a mini bottle in the mini-bar. In fact everything there is very expensive, but then again, you do have the quality and the numerous personnel at your disposal, so you have to know what you really want to pay for. Okay, just to split hairs, I'd say that the brass handle on the toilet door that kept falling off had not been repaired before our arrival (and still kept falling off when we left) and my husband got fed up of seeing the shade on one of the wall lamps all lopsided and put it straight! But that's all, oh yes, there seems to be something missing, a little "je-ne-sais-quoi". Even though the hotel's not that big, I never sensed a sort of “home from home” type atmosphere that I've found in other hotels of this genre. Is it because the personnel want to be discrete or is it because it’s the Spanish character? We went to the Westin Palace Hotel, just across the road, for dinner at the ASIS GALLERY RESTAURANT. The food was good but a bit too salty for us & the service was so fast that we had indigestion!! We had hardly ordered drinks than the starters arrived. The plates were taken away as soon as we had put our forks down, the main meal arrived etc etc. The Asian waitresses were not very professional either. The WESTIN PALACE HOTEL is luxurious (the hall and the dining areas) but incomparable to the Ritz. I’d say that the Westin is a 5* hotel but the Ritz is way above. There were people all over the place, talking and laughing loudly, walking around with drinks in their hands and dressed any old way. It’s much bigger than the Ritz. and there wasn’t this classy, hushed type atmosphere than you can find at the Ritz. Even if the RItz may have been full, we had the impression that there weren't very many people around, which is quite relaxing. The concierge at the Ritz suggested we go to the CORRAL DE LA MOREIRA to watch the best flamenco dancing in town. The spectacular quality of the show made up for the lousy food and rushed service, everyone being crushed like sardines into this big room and the waitress who dropped a creamy fish sauce down my husband’s jacket and hadn’t even noticed! The price of the “food” & show came up to 200 euros for the two of us, much too expensive for the quality of the food. Get there early in order to eat quickly and concentrate on the brilliant performance of the flamenco troupe. The Ritz is close to everything, no need to hire a car or get a taxi. Get to the Prado museum very early or else beware of queuing for ages and being crushed in the crowd in the actual visiting areas. We went back to the airport with the hotel’s limousine service, 100 euros but a taxi will cost you 30 euros. All in all, a very pleasant stay though Madrid is not an exceptional place, like Prague, Rome or Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Elegance and olde world charm”
Reviews.Author: CMC777
Reviews.Content: The Ritz in Madrid is with walking distance of all the major attractions of Madrid, Galleries, Rotiro Park and the city centre are all within minutes.. But what sets this hotel apart from most is its excellent and elegant service. Dining outside overlooking the garden is a particular treat..The surroundings are ageing somewhat but it still has great charisma and charm. A perfect retreat for those wanting a sophisticated getaway or to do business..

Reviews.Title: “Can't be beat...”
Reviews.Author: laurajyl
Reviews.Content: I just got back from a week long trip in Spain, 3 nights were spent at the Ritz. I cannot say enough about the service or the beauty of this hotel. Add to both those, the proxmity to the museums and other areas of Madrid, I will go back to the Ritz time and time again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely if faded”
Reviews.Author: Battistini1
Reviews.Content: We spent 8 days at the Ritz and we were very happy. Our room was antiquated true, with dated electrics, crowded bathroom, and faded rug. But the service was over-the-top warm and gracious. Truly, this hotel is made by its staff and its staff are wonderful, not one great guy but waiters, concierges, managers, bellhops, all extremely warm despite the language barrier (we speak no Spanish). The housekeeping was first-rate. We paid $330/night including a truly grandiose breakfast but not internet and we felt like royalty. This was my first trip to Madrid and Spain and I could not have picked a better place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: SusanaBaires
Reviews.Content: I was at the Ritz Madrid 3 weeks ago and what a surprise I had… I did not know what to expect, but must admit that the fantastic and personalized service really impressed me and made me feel like a queen… Also my room ( de luxe room) was just amazing with beautiful hand made carpets, antiques furniture and unique crystal chandelier made me feel as if I was in a palace .. Well done Ritz Madrid and it s team !! You really know how to make your guests feel much better than at home.

Reviews.Title: “Classic and Majestic”
Reviews.Author: MJSKS
Reviews.Content: Great royal hotel in a unbeatable location. Beautiful lobby, spacious rooms and first class luxury. Its style is majestic and service unsurpassed.

Reviews.Title: “Fine Hotel”
Reviews.Author: atticuss
Reviews.Content: A long weekend at the Ritz is a highly pleasurable experience. The hotel is superb - almost as good as the London Ritz - and the staff are remarkably friendly, courteous and helpful. The location could not be improved upon - stroll into the Retiro Park, the Prado is next door and the Thyssen Museum of Art across the way. Don't miss the Sunday Brunch (much better value than Dinner) nor a visit to the Botin Restaurant, 20 mins walk away and reputedly the oldest in the world.

Reviews.Title: “Well branded”
Reviews.Author: 99winter
Reviews.Content: I do wonder who pens some of these reviews? Our three night stay was one calamity after another. First on arrival our, at 3pm in a car organised by the hotel as part of our package, our room was not ready; we were asked to wait in the lounge and have a drink (which I though would be on the hotel but was put on our bill). An hour later we were told the room was ready. We were lead to a room, supposedly a deluxe room, before we entered the room we were told how lucky we were to have such a room, as in the opinion of the hotel employee it was one of the best rooms in the hotel. We nearly fell over when he opened the door. Deluxe? not even D! Frankly this room bore NO resemblance to any on the website, standard or deluxe! If they put this room on the website no one would ever stay at the Ritz Madrid. Also as part of our package we would receive a bottle of cava. As we had changed our allocated room we were told the bottle of cava would be brought round to our new room, which wasn’t much better than the first. Faded elegance is one thing but this had bits missing or very worn furniture. After three reminders, the night we arrived, the next morning and the morning after, 2 1/2 days later, our cava turned-up. On the first night they did not 'turn-down' or tidy our room. I asked them if this was usual, apparently yes! Also part of our package was a meal in the Goya dinning room. We could only have the set menu, which happened to be the same as the 'specials'. Yes the rubbish all restaurants pass-off as 'special'; the ingreadiance on or passed the sell by date. The car organised for our departure was waiting for us as we waited to be told it had arrived. They never thought about telling us it had arrived! This hotel is well branded "Ritz Madrid" is on everything, to give the impression of grandeur. We paid for 5 star service and received incommepance, lies and disinterest. Stay if you want to tell people you stayed at the Ritz, but if you want 5 Star surroundings and service, my advice is stay "across the road".

Reviews.Title: “pleased with the decision to stay here”
Reviews.Author: BiginMadrid
Reviews.Content: Spent a couple of days in Madrid and after lengthy research on the hotels in the city booked the Ritz Hotel for our stay. As far as location is concerned the hotel is ideal and across the road from the Westin Palace hotel (which probably would have been our first choice but didn't seem to have availability for the time we were there even though I was looking to book months ago) We got a good rate with TravelRepublic (cheaper than the hotel website) who I had never booked with before Anyway, having booked the Ritz I was pleased with the decision despite a number of reviews commenting upon the decor,etc around the hotel. We got there a little early but the staff invited us to have a drink (on the house) in the garden terrace whilst the room was being prepared. We were then escorted to our room (non-smoking) which was on the top floor. I must that say that given the number of previous reviews I have read regarding standard of rooms - I was pleasantly surprised. I wasn't sure whether this was the case due to being slightly out of the main tourist season. The room was bigger than I expected with built in wardrobes, the furniture was of a reasonable standard and in keeping with a traditional hotel. The bathroom was fine if not slightly small compared to the size of the room but no matter. The room had a TV/DVD - and (unlike any of the other hotels in Madrid it appears) with English speaking channels (BBC; Sky news; CNN this certainly made a difference) The hotel breakfast was perfectly adequate and the staff were attentive and polite at all times. We noticed a number of other residents walking around in jeans/t-shirts in the day but for dinner those dining in the restaurant the men did all have ties/jackets. We didn't eat at the hotel - the food was pricey and we prefered to head to the sol area which was only 10-15mins walk away. We did however do high tea at the Ritz (well you've got to haven't you) and had evening drinks in the lobby which was pleasant. There was a turndown service every evening with the maid leaving little chocolates, fruit, even a cake on our arrival! They didn't start cleaning too early in the morning either which is what I have read about some hotels This hotel is not cheap but with most things in life you get what you pay for and having walked around the city and seen the various locations of the hotels I had considered booking I was glad I decided to go for the Ritz. Those on the noisy Gran Via would be fine if you are young and with a group of frends, I guess. If you want a more hip and trendy hotel then the nearby Villa Real and Urban looked ok but the location and the little extras at the Ritz are what really set this hotel (and probably the Palace) apart from the others downtown. The 3 musems were very nearby, the Prado is literally across the road. I would recommend you get there early. The Royal Palace is a little further away but within walking distance. The Retiro park is also across the road and made for a nice afternoon stroll. There were a surprising number of Starbucks coffee shops dotted around the city so we were never far from a coffee break. Take a trip to the Plaza Mayor - it is by far the biggest square where everybody seems to congregate in the evenings or have a quiet drink in Plaza Santa Ana. Either way there are plenty of tapas bars in that area I would say that 3 nights is sufficient to see EVERYTHING in Madrid

Reviews.Title: “Rooms need work but the restaurant was terrific!”
Reviews.Author: Elisabeth_7
Reviews.Content: As other reviewers have indicated, this is not the Ritz experience most of us are used to. Decor is dated, rugs seem ancient, the overall feeling is very heavy. Our bathroom (in a deluxe room) was bizarre: a phone booth sized shower stall with no light (shower by feel), and a closet containing the bidet and toilet, so small that your knees hit the wall when you sat on the toilet. The location is great. I'm not sure I would do Madrid if I planned another trip to Spain...it is just another typical European city...loud, polluted, expensive. The Spanish are very proud of their art and should be but that is the only real attraction. Also, remember that most everything but the museums close at Saturday lunch for the rest of the weekend so there's not much to do! The terrace restaurant but even more the garden restaurant are just delightful. And they know how to make a terrific American martini! We spent an entire evening (7:30 to 1 am) with friends ordering successive rounds of tapas then dessert in the garden and the staff and food were both terrific.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Ritz in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: Karin246
Reviews.Content: The Ritz in Madrid is absolutely a world class hotel. We had a wonderful week in Madrid and its location is the best to visit what everybody seems to agree are some of the very best museums and art collections in the world. The entire hotel is beautiful. Minor problem: the breakfast room seems to not be able to accommodate many guests and they make one wait much too long for a table. I think that is not acceptable for such a great hotel. So many tourists were very upset at the long wait. For breakfast! This hotel is of a much, much higher category as the Ritz in Paris, no doubt about it.

Reviews.Title: “Could Use a Few Updates, but Still a Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: WynneWoody
Reviews.Content: The Ritz Madrid is truly one of Europe's grand old hotels. It is in a beautiful location, right across the street from the Prado Museum (which really is a must-see), and very close to shopping, the city's main park and many other of the city's best sights. Service is what you would expect from a 5-star property. Front desk, concierge, doormen/bellstaff, waitstaff and housekeeping all performed without flaw. Amenities are all very nice, although expensive, but that's what you would expect in a hotel of this sort. With $/Euro exchange rates what they are, a cosmopolitan in the hotel bar cost about $35. It was good, but not that good. At any rate, it was all a part of the grand experience of staying in one of Spain's great old hotels. Several posters have commented on the need for some updates, and it is true that there is some worn carpeting and dated decor, but for us, that was a part of the charm. Also, the bathrooms were designed during a bygone era, and the hotel has done a reasonably good job of updating them for modern conveniences, but it is still an old hotel, so everything is not quite as modern and convenient as you might like. If you must have everything completely modern, new and fresh, then this place may not be for you. For us, it was perfect and charming. Will stay there again, given the chance.

Reviews.Title: “Elegance and style”
Reviews.Author: Irishguest
Reviews.Content: This hotel is the epitome of elegance, The public rooms are magnificent but comfortable; the staff are plentiful and very helpful and the rooms have a charm and individuality that you don't often encounter nowadays. Some may find it all a bit dated but, to me, that was one of the attractions of the place. Mind you, it's very up to date in many ways - including the presence of a Nespresso machine in the room complete with a huge selection of coffee types. And despite what people say, they appear to have no difficulty with jeans or tieless and jacketless men in teh public areas. But be prepared to pay high prices for food and drink; you are paying for the surroundings and the legions of staff ! If orange juice at 14 euro or breakfast at 48 euro does not appeal, a delicious breakfast at a fraction of that price can be had at "Mallorca," an upmarket deli. a short walk away at the beginning of Calle Serrano.

Reviews.Title: “Superb stay”
Reviews.Author: sma912
Reviews.Content: The moment I arrived at this hotel I was impressed by the service and attention I received from all the staff. Every request I made was dealt with in a friendly and efficient manner. Given the Ritz's reputation, I was not disappointed by the hotel's facilities. My room was superb - very clean, spacious with luxurious featurs. All in all it was very comfortable and the perfect retreat from the city. Breakfast in the hotel was also very good. A great choice of food and, once again, superb service. My biggest compliment I could pay the hotel is the sheer elegance of the building and its furnishings. Whilst I felt I was in an exclusive enviroment, I never felt intimidated by this. The furnishings are delightful and I hope to return very soon!

Reviews.Title: “Did Not Disappoint”
Reviews.Author: Twopros
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a delightful 8-day stay at the Madrid Ritz. Reception was welcoming, efficient, and very gracious in giving us an upgrade as they had the availability. The spacious lst floor room overlooked the Prado, had a foyer, three large closets, large bath with window (also a Prado aspect), and the linen sheets were pure luxury. With orchids and lillies, fresh fruit daily, and unintrusive maid and turndown service, it was a pleasure to wake up in and come back to this vintage haven. The buffet breakfast was plentiful, high quality and attractively presented. Service was pleasant and attentive. We particularly noticed they refreshed the buffet items even up to the 11:00am closing. The location is simply the best in Madrid, and we are more than happy to report the Ritz did not disappoint!

Reviews.Title: “Luxury & Sassiness!”
Reviews.Author: Londonsassytraveller
Reviews.Content: In a few words, the right, the best and the most convinient hotel to stay in Madrid. Their restaurant is an excellent choice if to tired to go out, Friendly staff!

Reviews.Title: “Luxury 5*”
Reviews.Author: Worcs
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights in a classic room with courtyard view, the decor of the room was old-fashioned glamour as you would expect from the Ritz, the room was very spacious with 2 walk in closets, in the bathroom were Bulgari toiletries (the TV had a number of British stations BBC 1 & 2, ITV). I would also recomend eating at the Goya restaurant, I had breakfast each day and couple of dinners, or have a drink in the bar or afternoon tea in the beautiful lobby. Food and drink is very expensive but that was expected. The quality of room service food was equally high with very prompt delivery. I would definately recomend this hotel to anyone, I couldn't find any fault at all. Excellent location right in the middle of the 3 main art museums Reina Sofia, Prado and Thyssen-Bornemisza, which was my favourite of the 3. Its a 5 min walk to the main shopping street of Gran Via or Retiro Park and 5/10 mins to the designer shopping streets of Calle Serrano & Calle de Jose Ortega y Gasset where you will find Chanel, Gucci etc.

Reviews.Title: “Grand "Old World" style Great Location”
Reviews.Author: lvnluxury
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ritz for our first night in Spain prior to touring the La Rioja region and returning out of Barcelona. The Ritz was exactly as we had hoped it would be! A nicely rennovated grand old hotel in a european metropolitan city. We were not looking for modern furnishings as a lot of the top hotels are leaning towards. The Ritz have done a fantastic job blending in the new amenities such as flat screen televisions and espresso machine in the room. We booked the suite and were very satisfied with its size and location. My wife is a light sleeper and was not disturbed by city noises at all. The bathrooms were adequate in size and well done. The conceirge did a fantastic job understanding our request for a "local" restaurant recommendation and booked a table for us at Principe de Viana. Outstanding service, food and wine list! Breakfast was complete with European and American items with a nice presentation (if weather allows sit outside!). Oh yes, the courtyard! There is a beautiful courtyard shaded by century old oaks with white and blue whicker furniture. This is a must for a coffee or cava in the afternoon. Regretfully, we requested a bottle of champagne which was offered on the room service menu only to be informed that it was not available in the courtyard. The only other thing that could have made our stay better was to have had the room available earlier, however, we completely understood that with a Saturday arrival at 8:00 am this was simply impossible. All in all, The Ritz is the place to stay while in Madrid!

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Stay in a Terrific City”
Reviews.Author: Mroth
Reviews.Content: The Ritz Madrid did not disappoint.....old world charm in a mid size hotel right in the heart of the city next to the Prado.... Rooms were very nice.....staff excellent and price was fine Highly Recommend.....

Reviews.Title: “A classic getting a bit tired”
Reviews.Author: tuckie
Reviews.Content: It is always helpful to understand that staying at 5-star hotel in Europe is quite a different experience than staying at a 5-star hotel in Asia, or even the US for that matter. You’ll never get the service of the Oriental in Bangkok or the amenities of the St. Regis in NY. But what you do get is a heavy dose of old world charm. And yes, sometimes that does come in the form of a beautiful hand-loomed carpet that is a bit stained or a breakfast buffet with indifferent food. That is what I love about hotels like the Ritz. You have to take a portfolio view of the experience and not focus too hard on any one aspect. We stayed for three nights in early August and had (as we had requested) two connecting rooms on the fifth floor overlooking the Prado. What a spectacular view to wake up to in the morning! The rooms were very large (especially compared to Parisian hotel rooms) and well furnished…to the children’s delight there was even a flat screen TV with DVD player. The marble bathrooms were smallish but again, entirely in line with what I’d expect. Each day there was a special treat left for us….yellow plums one day, an apple tart the next. The service throughout our stay was passable although checkout turned into a bit of a circus with delayed bellman and apparently only one person at the front desk capable of resolving a billing error. Check your bill as there were two random charges posted to our account that were not ours. The breakfast room was lovely, although on the small side so crowded in the morning. The food was indifferent and the buffet was laid out in various stations which was the tiniest bit annoying. And service was a little on the slow side….getting a coffee refill required asking the waiter rather than the staff being proactive. The location is perfect. An easy walk to all of the major sights. And with small children an easy walk is imperative. Overall we had a very pleasant stay at the Ritz. Don’t expect everything to be perfectly polished and immaculately maintained….but then again, that is the charm of the place after all.

Reviews.Title: “Putting on the "Ritz"”
Reviews.Author: Broadband
Reviews.Content: Wonderful from the moment we arrived. Rooms were gorgeous and they even upgraded us. If you wish the finest hotel in Madrid this is it. Nothing compares to this hotel. It is five star plus. No hesitations enjoy your stay.

Reviews.Title: “6 Star”
Reviews.Author: Traveling_Lad
Reviews.Content: Spent a few days here with the Mrs and had a great time, Barca is lovely and the hotel is even better. Although a trek from the Designer shops, Gucci, Vuitton etc the hotel is second to none, We stayed in a suite which cost a pretty penny but wa swell worth it. The lovely bar downstairs is a nice and quiet environment, exactly what we were looking for and spent a few nights down there, the room bills was scary when we left but you only live once.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible Service”
Reviews.Author: texaninflorida
Reviews.Content: Speedy check-in service with helpful bell staff who tried to speak our language - successfully. Welcome cake and water with glasses brought to our room by welcoming staff just as our luggage arrived as we were shown around the room by the front desk staff. Gorgeous all-marble bathroom with 2 sinks and separate marble shower w/ rain head and tub.; shower had great water pressure. Linen hand towels and huge terry towels on warmer and robes. Appreciated the 3 separate huge walk-in closets and view of Prado. We spent time touring and returned to our room to find bottle of chilled champagne with glasses waiting. Had dinner outside at their restaurant (in the garden) and the service was impeccable as was the ambiance. We had chateaubriand for 2 and was about 180euros. They had a fixed price menu for about 95euros that was several courses with wine pairings and included the wine - a good deal if you wanted to try 4 glasses of wine. The breakfast buffet was included in our 375euro rm and was excellent with several choices in a beautiful dining room even had warmed plates for the hot food choices). Our luggage was lost and the concierge made mult calls for us to try to obtain for us. The concierges (there were 2 or 3 at the desk everytime we went by) were most helpful in telling us what to do for our 1 day in Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Fit for Royalty”
Reviews.Author: NanaSueNewYork
Reviews.Content: This is a true five-star hotel. The faultless but friendly, service; the gorgeous lobby, the beautiful antiques throughout, the fine bed linens, the little comforts, plus the perfect location all contributed to our happiness for the six days my husband and I stayed there. It is big enough to offer privacy but not so large as to feel impersonal. It is an elegant hotel. Our superior, double room seemed more like a small apartment than a hotel room. A foyer led to a medium sized room furnished in tasteful French antiques, including a crystal chandelier and an antique rug. The room was extremely clean and comfortable with every detail carefully thought out. The lighting was excellent and there was generous closet space--even a separate closet to hold our luggage. The large windows overlooked a terrace, and a tree lined street. They were soundproof and the air conditioning worked well. Every day the king sized bed was made up with fresh, monogramed linen sheets. The bathroom had a separate shower, double sinks, a large soaking tub, a separate toilet/bidet compartment, and a window. The concierge staff were exceptionally helpful in choosing restaurants and giving directions. Excellent location for museum going--two minutes walk to the Prado, five minutes to Thyssen-Bornemiza. Near to the Botanical Gardens, too. Walking distance to many other site and near the main rail station, a convenience for day trips by train. Tip: Our travel agent booked directly with the hotel and cobbled together several packages which helped lower the price and provided certain amenities--airport transfers,use of fitness center, a bottle of Cava and other goodies. One complaint: a "free dinner" included in one package was restricted to a limited set menu. We were encouraged to put the value of that meal toward ordering a la carte. We did so, but felt this restriction should have been made clear in the package description. The restaurant was beautiful but over priced and the food average. Do try to get the breakfast buffet included in your rate. It is expensive, elegant and excellent. American Express Platinum card holders get an automatic upgrade to a junior suite.

Reviews.Title: “Very Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: world_traveller034
Reviews.Content: We booked the Ritz for it name expecting 5 stars standard. But we were very disappointed its below an average. We booked 5 nights, the first room had chidren chair and the bed was overused and damaged my back. We complained and were reluctantly moved to a better room. The following day were given wrong direction by conceirge we spent 3 hours in train station on our way to Toledo. Also, we were sent to a 1 star resturant and they refused to do anything about it. Apart from that, my prayer bookes had been stolen from the room without a trace and nothing they do about it. We rented a car through the hotel, from Eurocar with a broken GPS which took us 6 hours to get to Segovia, we returned 11pm to madrid. It was horrifiying experience. The following day we went for breakfast room, the manager turn us away, saying they are busy to come 15 minutes later, which we did 3 times, we were not offered any alternative, that is no five star. We should never go through in a 1 star hotel, let alone the Ritz. We were very upset about this complained to the guest relation, who wa surprised and sent to our room a bottle of cheap champaine. Come on, we left for the maid, needless to say. we do not want a cheapy champaine from the Ritz, we expect a 5 star treament that we are paying for, but expected superficial grandur. We complained to the Ritz management but they care less for any of the service and recommendation, telling us they are sorry for our trip to spain was not pleasant. We are raising this with concerns to bring awareness to all travellers, the Ritz Madrid seems to be a Business gathering hotel and do not caters for tourist who have few days to enjoy the best of Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel but could use some upgrading”
Reviews.Author: jah123
Reviews.Content: We first stayed at the Ritz in the mid-80s and have returned numerous times. The Ritz has a beautiful garden to have a a drink, a sherry or a glass of wine, and a great terrace to have breakfast. The Ritz adjoins the Prado, is near the other art museums, is near the Retiro (great for a jog), and is near the old part of Madrid with its great tapas restaurants. Thus, all the best you can ask for along with an excellent staff and service. However, to maintain its status among the best European hotels, I suggest that the bathrooms should be upgraded and the wedding noise on weekends be curtailed after midnight. Grand hotels are great places for weddings, but guests should not be listening to a band at 3AM.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: fortune
Reviews.Content: Checked in at this grand hotel + were given a fabulous room. Staff were lovely + could not do enough. Only had breakfast at the hotel which was plentiful. Hotel in a great location next to the Prado + a short walk from El Retiro park. Really enjoyed this romantic stay!

Reviews.Title: “lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: MPL
Reviews.Content: The Ritz is a lovely old fashioned hotel. It is very central next door to the Prada gallery and within walking distance to most of the attractions. We arrived on a Saturday evening and were given a room on the 5th floor. On the original booking it had said that we might be upgraded to a larger room. We mentioned this and they promised we would be moved the next day. We were moved to a huge room also on the 5th floor which was really lovely. Both rooms had massive bathrooms and bath robes. There were no tea/coffe making facilities in the rooms but there was a fairly expensive drinks bar. Our breakfast was included in the room price and was very good. Lots of fresh fruit, cold meat platters, pastries and full cooked breakfast. The service was one of the best I have ever come across in a hotel and the staff were really nice and friendly. All in all a very enjoyable trip. I would certainly recommend this hotel. OK the restaurant and lounge drinks prices are expensive but you do not have to eat there.

Reviews.Title: “Old World Elegance”
Reviews.Author: ShutterGo
Reviews.Content: Staying at the Ritz was like staying in a museum. From the time we entered the lobby to the comfort of our room, we had a feeling as though we'd stepped back in time. The service was excellent, the facilities first rate, and the overall experience unmatchable. We've stayed in Four Seasons/Ritz Carltons in the US and the decor in those was brand new old Europe. In this hotel, the carpets are original (and are repaired rather than replaced) and this reflects the general sense of having traveled back in time. If you want new and shiney, this isn't the place to stay. If you've ever visited Hearst Castle and wished you could stay a night, this is the place. The only downside was the expensive food. Our most expensive meal while in Madrid was our breakfast at the Ritz. Our room at a basic rate (see below) was spacious, including a large bathroom and a flat panel tv. When we needed an extra pillow, the service was prompt and they offered a pillow menu to made a choice. The Madrid Bus stops right out front. It's 14 euros and is the best way to travel around Madrid. It makes frequent stops and you can hop on and off at different sites around Madrid. We booked on Expedia at the last minute and got an incredible rate of $259 per night for 3 nights (special was to pay for 2 nights, get one free), which made staying at the Ritz possible.

Reviews.Title: “Totally pampered”
Reviews.Author: VanGogh2
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 4 nights at the Ritz in November. Before we arrived, I was somewhat concerned as some other reviewers had expressed displeasure with their accommodations. I must say that I was thrilled by our stay. As most mentioned, the lobby and the lounge areas behind it are absolutely gorgeous. The dining room's food and service at dinner were as delightful as the decoration. At check in, we were welcomed warmly and shown to our room on the 5th floor. We had booked a junior suite which proved to be so large, that it actually had two room numbers, the second for the sitting area. The room was elegantly appointed and the bathroom generous. The towels were changed twice a day and the laundry service, while super expensive, excellent. The concierge made dinner reservations for us every night, including 2 which I arranged by fax from home. They earned every penny of their pay, however, by managing to get us entry to the Palacio di Liria to see the Duchess of Alba's art collection. It was a wonderful stay in luxurious surroundings.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent every time”
Reviews.Author: Cojones
Reviews.Content: A romantic weekend in the Ritz with my girlfriend and I enjoyed every minute. They could do with a pool but the gym is adequate as no one is ever in there. They put us in a lovely large room overlooking the street. Breakfast was great, Bvlgari toiletries appealed to my girl friend, staff were lovely and the concierge was great. Best part is the bar - we asked them to try to make a Vesper cocktail and after we gave them the menu they made us a complimentary one. A great weekend. For those who haven't been, the location is amazing. I went to Uni in Madrid and know where the places to see are and from this hotel everything (museums, plaza maya, plaza santa ana) is within a 10-15 minute walk. I considered trying the Urban hotel for a change as it gets good reviews, however, having stopped for a drink in their small overcrowded bar I am glad I didn't. The bar was full of drinkers like us - just popping in for a drink and it was obvious that hotel guests couldn't get a seat. I wouldn't stay anywhere else in Madrid except the Ritz.

Reviews.Title: “A Let Down”
Reviews.Author: Brum74
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Ritz in June. Upon arrival we were really pleased as the reception areas are beautiful. Unfortunately, first impressions are not always the right ones. We were shown to our room, which we were told had beautiful views as it was on the top floor. The view was indeed beautiful, if I stood on a chair to look out of the window. As we were in a room which was effectively in the roof space. About 2/3 of the room had a ceiling so low, we could not stand up. The room was very dark as it had one tiny window in what was quite a large room. The bathroom was well equipped but small. We complained this was not a room in which we could possibly spend 4 nights. We were then advised the reason we had been put in that room was that the President of the Philippines (and her massive entourage) had stayed on a night longer than expected. We were advised that we were lucky not to have been sent to another hotel as other guests had. We were told if we could bear with them just one night they would put us in the room which was originally intended for us! We did stay and our replacement room was wonderful. 5th floor with great views. Again, the bathroom was tiny but well equipped. The concierge desk was not good. Whilst polite and friendly, they sent us to a restaurant which was not open on a Monday. We ended up eating at the small neighbourhood restaurant a few doors away with only 2 other diners. They also made a reservation in a smoking area when we had specifically asked for non-smoking. I would have put it down to the restaurant but upon return I asked the concierge who looked at the note pad and it revealed The Ritz had asked for a smoking section. My biggest problem with this hotel was service, or the lack of it. Despite our dodgy first night which was understandable in the circumstances, the hotel made up for that. However, there was just no service. Concierge was not good, the staff not very friendly and other than eventually getting a nice room, there is very little to do there as there is no pool, the gardens are given to the restaurant so one cannot just relax in them without paying a fortune for drinks/food you do not want but are obliged to order. We were asked not to sit in the gardens unless we were drinking/dining. Having stayed at The Ritz, London and dined at The Ritz, Paris; Ritz Madrid is just not in their league. It is a poor provincial cousin and is a substandard 4* hotel which is saved only by an impressive lobby and great location.

Reviews.Title: “Hairs in the bathroom not mine!”
Reviews.Author: dannymcl
Reviews.Content: Very simply, seriously expensive hotels should not have previous occupants hairs lying around the bathroom and toilet floors! My room was surprisingly small and overlooked an internal room space. There were few amenities in the room - no coffee maker nor kettle and the TV had a pretty poor selection of channels. Hi Speed internet connection via Eurospot was incredibly expensive at around €20 per day - that's simply a rip off. The desk in the room just seemed to be too low or the chair too high. Location good but overall, the hotel did just not have that "wow" factor that really good hotels do.

Reviews.Title: “Great week at the Ritz”
Reviews.Author: elderlytraveler
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a lovely week's stay at the Ritz, and was very pleased with the experience. Partly due, I suppose, to a certain nostalgia for those days years ago when my late wife and I stayed there on our relatively frequent trips to Madrid. The only changes I noticed since my last stay some 20 years ago were a plasma TV and internet acess in the room, an alarming increase in the price of everything, and a shocking deterioration in the dress code of the guests. The site of a host of fat and frumpy elderly ladies in shorts was enough to ruin an otherwise excellent and generous champagne buffet breakfast. The decor, furnishings and grounds reflect the gentility and elegance of a bygone era; the service was impeccable: prompt, friendly, attentive, helpful, dignified and never obsequious. The "single" I had reserved at a promotional price proved to my surprise to be a huge, quiet double room facing the Prado Museum, with an average sized bathroom with separate WC and all the amenities one would expect in a 5 star hotel. A liesurely dinner on the terrace of the Hotel's "Goya" Restaurant is a highly civilized (albeit costly) gastronomic delight. And for me the Hotel's location in proximity to Madrid's three greatest museums was a crucial attraction, as they were the principal goal of my trip.

Reviews.Title: “More of the same...”
Reviews.Author: Campanu
Reviews.Content: Alter having read the last opinión, I may need to agree with it. And I hate it, because I love the Ritz and I love being there. Ok, rooms are old, no services, no sauna, no pool, everything is really expensive (i.e. internet connection fees), erratic service in the bar… all charged at a very high price. But I love it, and I love the location, and I love the way the doorman greets me and my friends, and how he likes taking care of our cars, and yes… I love the breakfast. I know it is not the best quality, and I know staff is not the best. Probably it is because they know me that I get nice service… which should be considered more as a fault, a terrible fault from the hotel, to treat better the well-known guests. For my next trip I’ll probably try the Urban, but I’m sure I will come back. It is a shame they don’t just close the hotel, remove almost everything, and open it back on a modern and updated way. Yes, I like the place, but I hate to pay for it and I hate almost every single thing of it.

Reviews.Title: “Does not deserve the name or 5 star rating”
Reviews.Author: Travel_Hedonist
Reviews.Content: Being privileged to be able to stay in some of the best properties around the world during 75 days of travel per year, I was looking forward to staying at this "legendary" hotel for the first time. After an average arrival and check-in I was somewhat disturbed by the twin-bedded double room with two single beds (that I hadn't requested at reservation stage and that were tiny) and by the fact that it presented itself in generally poor condition. In addition to the room being dark and very faded, the carpet was worn and dirty and the furniture in desperate need of re-upholstry, whilst most surfaces appeared to last have been dusted prior to Franco's coming to power. It being late, I not only decided to not make a fuss about the room, but also not to try and find an open restaurant and therefore opted for room service. A Club Sandwich, some sliced fruit and a bottle of Evian strikes me as an order that is possibly processed 5 million times a day across thousands of hotels around the world and that requires little culinary expertise. Although the delivery was timely, the quality of the sandwich was simply hideous. I will spare you the details but suggest to opt out of Room Service, given that the anti-climactic food experience comes paired with an obscene price tag ( In my case €68). Although my 7.30 wake up call never arrived, my €3 local newspaper did. Shame I couldnt read it with a coffee, for its neither offered nor available as part of the wake up call (if I had received it) in absence of in-room facilities. Anxious to get my first caffeine fix, I went to the breakfast restaurant and was seated in a very pleasant terrace area, looking forward to catching up on proper food. In summer the terrace provides a beautiful backdrop and is enjoyable, though traffic noise is continuous. Did I say opt out of Room Service? Make that "Opt out of eating and drinking. Fullstop." The coffee I received (after asking for it twice) tasted like washing liquid and the canned orange juice was a close match. The selection and quality of food on the makeshift and improvised looking buffet scattered around the room was simply pathetic. Admittedly, breakfast is an issue in 9 out of 10 hotels (though it really isnt that difficult), but The Ritz has entered my personal hall of fame for the worst hotel breakfasts ever. The staff at breakfast very much appears untrained and are being commandeered by old waiters in ill-fitting and worn uniforms. A smile is not part of the items available at breakfast (or indeed throughout the hotel). The remainder of my stay remained equally unimpressive and if you have ever called hotels like The Peninsula Hong Kong, Claridges in London or George V in Paris your home, this isnt the hotel for you.

Reviews.Title: “I feel so bad!”
Reviews.Author: PICKYTRAVELER27
Reviews.Content: I feel horrible, I tried to love it. I bet about 40 years ago I would have adored it. The good:hand loomed carpet, marble bathroom, great location, wonderful service, great view of the museums. Instead of listing the bad I'll just say that I felt like I was in a nightmare version of Versailles. The major props that they get is the private guide that they recommended to my travel agent -her name is Isabel Cortes and is one of the most incredible people I've ever met. I would recommend using her--she knows everything and more and takes wonderful pictures. And of course Omar--one of the hotels drivers that drove us around for the day in an S Class Mercedes. All in all, I didn't cry when I got there, I just wasn't head over heels with it. I think they said they are renovating soon so I would probably go back after the renovation but not before.

Reviews.Title: “Old World Elegance”
Reviews.Author: diamondsgirl
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Ritz Hotel in Madrid Spain. We were there for 2 nights May1st and 2nd 2006. This hotel is all about "old world elegance". We booked through American Express and were upgraded to a junior suite upon arrival. It had a spacious bedroom with twin beds. (We gladly gave up a deluxe room with a king bed to have the separate livingroom) the bathroom was small with only one sink in the vanity. The rain down shower head didnt work that well. The common rooms are very opulently decorated, and yet not stuffy. The Ritz has a beautiful outdoor garden where we had lunch both days, and a formal diningroom, Goya, where breakfast is served daily and dinner most nights. A word of caution about dining at the Ritz.Make your reservations prior to arriving for dinner at the Goya restaurant. If you wait until you arrive, as we did , it was fully booked both nights and our only other choice was to eat in the Hall Bar (tapas). The conceirge arranged for a last minute side trip to Toledo,which we highly recommend taking. Toledo is a stunningly beautiful city. One not to be missed if you are as close as Madrid. We would definitely stay here again over the Westin Madrid, because it had a cozier less business-like atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular Hotel”
Reviews.Author: joansmithe
Reviews.Content: I would highly recommend this hotel. It is in a great location. The Hotel is beautiful and the service is the best I've seen. The buffet breakfast is excellent. The rooms are beautifully decorated.

Reviews.Title: “First class setting in a old world setting”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Great hotel for a visit to Madrid - first class service, old world charm but with modern facilities. Almost over staffed so there is always someone available to help you - friendly and totally professional service without any kind of complications. Rooms are old fashion in some respect but with e.g. broadband and wifi access in all rooms. Great bfast room. No faults.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Matt-7
Reviews.Content: I could not fault this hotel. My girl friend and I, both early thirties professionals, stayed for a 2 night weekend break from 6-8 Jan and could not fault the hotel. The service was exceptional. Particular highlights were a mid-afternoon fruit / sweet selection delivered to the room, a bed turn down service including the Ritz Daily Times to highlight local events the next day and the most helpful concierge I've ever met. (Try a restaurant called Zalacain if you have the opportunity!). The hotel could not be better placed. I studied for a year in Madrid in my youth and was based in the North West which was a long trek to the Prado / Reina Sofia, however, from the Ritz everything is within walking distance and we only used the Metro once. The lobby is great for reading the paper and an afternoon coffee. The prices for drinks in the lobby are expensive - €9 for a coke but you don't have to have one. I will only stay at this hotel whilst in Madrid in the future! The Westin Palace is across the road and if you're looking for a cheaper version then it looks equally impressive inside although more worn from the outside!!

Reviews.Title: “The Glamour and Gitz Have Gone”
Reviews.Author: quietbreeze
Reviews.Content: To say I was shocked is an understatement. To be listed as a Leading Hotel of the World must be a joke. We checked into the hotel for a three night stay over the Christmas holiday. The staff were very professional and pampered to your every need. The room that we were shown was in a horrible state. The carpet was worn and black around the edges. The wallpaper was dark and dinghy and the bed was the smallest double I have ever seen. Looking forward to a grand and exceptional hotel, my disappointment could not be contained. It is a hotel that has passed its expiration date. Once I am sure it was a glorious property; however it has seen its last days and is beginning to show all signs of ageing very quickly. After one night of sleeping on top of each other for lack of space in the smallest double I have seen, we checked out the next morning in search of other accomdations. The hotel is very overpriced for what you receive.

Reviews.Title: “Five Star with a sting!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just enjoyed two nights in a deluxe double at The Ritz Madrid as a celebration for my wife's birthday while visiting Europe. Firstly, lets establish that the Ritz Madrid is not connected to any other "Ritz" hotels in London and Paris...this is not part of a chain, it is just a name. The place is a slightly faded five star that has seen better days. However, they make up for this with exceptional service and an amazing dining terrace, which would be magnificent in warmer months and perhaps even the best spot in the city. The service was superb. Understated, non-pretentious and friendly...they even have a sense of humour! The public rooms are perfect if you seek the nostalgia of times past. However, this is simply not a place that would appeal to most under 60's!...In fact the lounge is so stuffy that most younger guests would feel very uncomfortable meeting for a drink in the lobby. The other downside is the inflated charges for services. eg: I ordered coffee and toast from the "a la carte" menu and they charged 32 euros per person. Any way you look at it, 64 euros for coffee and toast for two is almost criminal! Then there was the 24 euros for a very poor internet connection (Double the rate of other 5 stars in madrid!) A hotel with such high service standards demeans itself with such greedy overcharging for services. They really need to catch up with the approach and style of the five star hotels in Barcelona. But perhaps The Ritz is a better reflection of the style of Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Not Ritz at its best”
Reviews.Author: agro
Reviews.Content: In a nuthshell: not Ritz at its best. The interiors are quite old fashioned and old, well mantained, but old. The rooms are very good, with everything you would expect from Ritz. Sport equipment very basic, no swimming pool, the gym is very basic. Bar and restaurant are very good. The business centre is quite basic, very small with a few computers packed one next to the other. The Ritz in Lisbon is so many times better

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel in a wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in November, 2005. We found the staff very friendly and helpful. We stayed in a very large Junior suite, with a view of the Prado museum. The rooms were very classic and elegant, and the bathroom was large and modern. We also had afternoon tea at the Ritz, which was something not to be missed!

Reviews.Title: “A beautiful place to stay in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: Seckel
Reviews.Content: After staying at the Westin Palace, we moved to the Ritz for the second part of our stay in Spain. What a difference! The Ritz is elegant, quiet and beautiful, with a beautiful garden restaurant and a large lounge with newspapers, an excellent afternoon tea and wonderful service. The staff was friendly and helpful at all times with good suggestions for sightseeing and dining. The room was large and comfortable with good room and maid service and beautiful decor that included embroidered linen sheets and a huge amount of closet space. The location is quieter than that of the Westin Palace; the hotel is located just across the street from the Prado.

Reviews.Title: “Things to be aware of”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have just spent the weekend at this hotel. It is above average but I can't believe it is one of the top ten hotels in the world. Prospective guests should be aware that at present the main restaurant 'Goya' is closed for refurbishment. Like a previous reviewer we were in quite a small room which was on the inside of the building looking out only on to the centre well. The bathroom was very cramped, certainly by U.S. standards. The T.V. set had an endearing habit of switching itself on loudly at various hours during the night! On the plus side the staff are absolutely marvellous - ultra polite, friendly and very helpful. Nothing seemed too much trouble for them. Overall though I don't think we would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: jpjaibrett
Reviews.Content: I am frankly quite surprised to see so many complaints about the Ritz. We stayed in July with our 3 children (ages 9, 6, and 1) and were very happy. We had reserved two connecting deluxe doubles. The rooms were on the first floor, quite spacious, clean, elegantly decorated - with a view from french doors out to the side street. Yes - it is expensive - but no more so than any other major city hotel. I found the service very prompt and very professional. My children (and believe me - the toddler is a devil!) were also treated quite well. I had made two requests via e-mail to the concierge - one for tickets to a bullfight, one for a private driver/guide for a morning of sightseeing. Both requests were handled seemlessly. And finally as regards the staff - my Spanish is fairly basic - but (unlike my experiences in Italy) when I spoke to any staffmember in Spanish - they politely responded in Spanish as well - this is very important to me - because part of the enjoyment of traveling is practicing a foreign language. However, when my husband (who is terrible with languages) spoke in English - they responded to him in English. Everyone was polite and professional. We had a lovely stay.

Reviews.Title: “Complimentary Dinner?”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Reception needs to get their act together. The first room we were shown - 501 had twin beds while a king bed had been confirmed. We had a miserable "complimentary" dinner in their Goya restaurant. My husband had to leave the restaurant, go to Reception for a "coupon" that we should have been given at check in. He didn't have the confirmation letter with him so I had to leave the restaurant, go back to the room and retrieve it. Went back to Reception and they finally decided that we did have the dinner coming. They then gave me the "coupon". We were then given a one sheet paper menu with 2 courses while everyone else in the restaurant had huge menus with many choices. We asked for another menu and they said that was all there was. The complimentary appetizer was actually a piece of the canelloni that was the same as the entree. No garnish, no vegetable. Just a overly rich foie gras with 8 green beans for the 1st course and 4 very rich and tiny canelloni for the 2nd course. A bottle of wine was included - we needed it. Felt like second class citizens. Breakfast was the same - had to produce the confirmation letter - buffet breakfast daily was included. Our last night we had a late night drink in the "garden" so we could hear the piano. The street noise was so loud we couldn't hear ourselves talk. Oh yes, our room - was beautiful - service was great but we were in 301 - adjoining an exterior wall where they were doing major construction from 8 in the morning to 8 at night. Jackhammers and concrete drilling. Our bathroom window nearly had the scaffolding in it. We had dinner one night at the Palace Hotel. They were very gracious. We would stay there again if ever in Madrid. We did go to Botin Restaurant - oldest restaurant in the world. Had roast suckling pig. A great dinner. Also, went to a bullfight. Quite an experience. The concierge staff though is very good. They know the city well.

Reviews.Title: “Come on you guys!”
Reviews.Author: Joycenola
Reviews.Content: This place is just ok. Considering what we paid to stay at the Ritz, we could have stayed at any number of places in town that were half the price, and equally as nice. After reading the reviews on TripAdvisor, we were expecting something really swanky! Yes - this is a charming little place, but lets face it, there are plenty of charming places in Madrid. Do yourself (and your wallet) a favor, shop around before booking at the Ritz.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: London_UKCaroline
Reviews.Content: A perfectly run old school hotel with delightful staff for whom nothing is too much trouble. The rooms whilst old fashioned in decor are beautifully kept with delicious sheets and nice goodies in the bathrooms (if I could find one thing to complain about it would be that the bathroom of our suite was tiny but we managed!). We stayed with two small children and very quickly felt completely at home.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: skrosvik
Reviews.Content: I had one of my best hotel experiences here at this very fine hotel. I think this is far better than Villa Magna in the same city. Our stay was just great. Lovely room and lovely employees. The amenities in the room was great. Even the manager was very nice to us. Well, this is what to expect from a Ritzy hotel. We will definately return to this hotel!
